commit_message:
Add load_from_options_getter to plugin loading

Loading from getter function was introduced into keystoneclient as a way
to enable OCC and auth_token middleware to define more unusual loading
mechanisms.

It was skipped in the move to keystoneauth. This adds it back.

Closes-Bug: #1514339
Change-Id: I1d464917e0ddec8e13f9395ad75db6ccc53cb813

commit_message:
Added HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTO/HOST support to API

 * Added oslo.middleware's HTTPProxyToWSGI middleware
 * Deprecated designate's SSL middleware
 * Fixed "//" in versions URIs

Change-Id: Id205246f791f33fd02aa9a17d4247bdf5b310088

(1 comment)

See comment inline. While useful for operators who are also deploying workloads, I think this will leave nodes in Maintenance mode without necessarily preserving the logs as intended, when users of Nova encounter any transitive failure and delete their instance. As Josh pointed out, the failure scenarios which this is intended to aid in resolving are likely not issues that require human<->machine intervention, iow, they don't require "maintenance".

If the use-case here is "operator wants to review the logs of a failed deploy" then I think work should go into retrieving and saving those logs, rather than leaving the ramdisk running. We need to start collecting serial console logs  as well - that may as well use a similar system for log storage.

If the use-case is "assist operator in debugging new deploy ramdisk" then I think a debug flag which could be toggled (perhaps even per-node) might be better suited to facilitate this.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2015-05-06 13:22:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I just reverted the patch in nova. I will find a better way of doing this :-)

https://review.openstack.org/180446

Thanks all for the comments'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2015-05-06 13:29:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2015-11-24 16:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

> If the use-case here is "operator wants to review the logs of a failed deploy" then I think work should go into retrieving and saving those logs

what about "operator wants to quickly apply a patch and see if it fixes IPA"? which is something I have to do right now...'}]

commit_message:
Troubleshoot: Do not power off node if deployment fails

This patch is adding a configuration option to the drivers called
"power_off_deploy_fail", by default the value is True and it will power
off the node when deployment fails (just like today). If set to False it
will put the node in maintenance mode and will not call power off. The
option is specially useful when used with the IPA ramdisk, since it allows
operators to SSH into it and check the deployment logs to try to figure
out why it failed, and for that we need to keep the node powered on.

Closes-Bug: #1443374
Depends-On: Ifb69fddd0a595a4b9fceee37841a132c23c24968
Change-Id: Ie17dba05435248c9161737f93b3c4d87d0259002

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-13 20:30:34.000000000', 'message': "remove Python 2.6-specific logging workaround

0ff39c14 (December 2013) introduced this LoggingHandlerWeakRef to work
around a problem in which file descriptors would be leaked under Python
2.6. But we don't support 2.6 anymore.

Change-Id: I1cd8249dfe17bce9cb301d13b761c11d2efd11d3
"}]
commit_message:
remove Python 2.6-specific logging workaround

0ff39c14 (December 2013) introduced this LoggingHandlerWeakRef to work
around a problem in which file descriptors would be leaked under Python
2.6. But we don't support 2.6 anymore.

Change-Id: I1cd8249dfe17bce9cb301d13b761c11d2efd11d3

commit_message:
support queue based communication between evaluator and notifier

we don't need rpc and it's slower, let's stop using it.

Change-Id: I3fc4d4a4bce732a6e0be05d77181caf5237d1f64

commit_message:
fix some test cases wrongly skipped for mysql backend

There are 10 test cases which is skipped when we run mysql functional
test, because they are decorated by run_with(), which expects to be
handled by engine mysql, but gets engine mysql+pymysql.

This patch maps engine mysql+pymysql to mysql to enable these tests.

Change-Id: Ief0646b6ca66e514300cbc93d3e5e66b0573b590
Closes-Bug: #1519211

commit_message:
gnocchi: only evaluate the required eval_periods

The threshold evaluator retrieves one more evaluation_periods
from the backend via _statistic() and assumes _sanitize()
pick up only correct number of evaluation periods.

This fixes the gnocchi threshold evaluator to return
the correct number of evaluation periods.

Related-bug: #1506911
Related-bug: #1513092
Change-Id: Ic010d54d9e7c42d6d846fe76812cd0c0e5f0835e

commit_message:
docs: update the concept guide shelve actions

The shelve_offload action is missing from the concept guide.
This updates the description of the shelve actions to include
shelve_offload. The text is slightly changed to keep the flow.

blueprint complete-todo-in-api-concept-doc

Change-Id: I15d574adfef5b604b5bf0fdfb254d703ac13e1bb

commit_message:
Freescale FWaaS Plugin code final decomposition.

This removes all the artifacts specific to Freescale FWaaS Plugin code
from the neutron-fwaas tree.

The code is maintained at github repository.

Setup option "fsl_firewall" for this plugin are removed in
change: I194a4da49058724766b7fde7343f85d19a75fe8c

UpgradeImpact

Change-Id: I5d419671cf3ce3dc10020949bc14bb9d8031da3f
Closes-Bug: #1519223

commit_message:
Allow saving and caching the plugin auth state

Particularly for allowing the CLI to store and reuse previous
authentication allow an application to extract and reinstall the
auth state from a plugin.

We provide a method that returns a dictionary of all of the identifiable
information that is used to create a plugin. This dictionary is hashed
to uniquely identify the plugin.

We then have a get_auth_state and set_auth_state function, the return of
which is intended to be opaque to the calling application. If the plugin
created returns an ID of an existing authentication you can call
set_auth_state to load that state. If the state is out of date it will
be refreshed as per normal otherwise it will be used instead of
authenticating again.

There is not support for caching federated tokens in this patch. They
will follow the exact same pattern and are not much harder they just
need a way for subclasses to signal they are cachable and so can be done
as a follow up.

Implements: bp cachable-auth
Change-Id: I4eebe7ff8060a37f19af5decfa3a8313cfb7c207

commit_message:
Reduced the complexity of the __init__ method

The get_events method is very large - almost 100 lines
(in ceilometer/api/controllers/v2/query.py).
I extracted some of the functionalities into helper functions
to reduce the length and complexity of __init__.
Additionally it became more readable as well, without
changing its functionality.

Change-Id: I6c258293295c43d0c406e2906db90841c97fcd33

commit_message:
Install magnum-common packages for binary builds

User magnum is missing from the binary image, install magnum-common to
fix this.

Closes-Bug: 1519390
Change-Id: I23e1206ab14b02de716374d28be2ef42e75e5beb

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 13:38:53.000000000', 'message': "remove unnecessary mock for rpc server start

latest oslo.messaging 3.0.0 requires invoking start() first then stop()
can be called, but we've mocked the start() which will hang the process
then finally raise TimeoutException.

Change-Id: I5a0e01cac52f9bf313bd06682660ff470b267c0c
Co-Authored-By: ZhiQiang Fan <aji.zqfan@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1519182
"}]
commit_message:
remove unnecessary mock for rpc server start

latest oslo.messaging 3.0.0 requires invoking start() first then stop()
can be called, but we've mocked the start() which will hang the process
then finally raise TimeoutException.

Change-Id: I5a0e01cac52f9bf313bd06682660ff470b267c0c
Co-Authored-By: ZhiQiang Fan <aji.zqfan@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1519182

commit_message:
Fixed incorrect name of 'tag' and 'tag-any' filters

According to spec
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/mitaka/approved/tag-instances.html
these filters should be named 'tags' and 'tags-any'.

Closes-Bug: #1506786

Change-Id: If5fabe5c6afa3bf6cc8e5045250fefdce58e6930

commit_message:
Correct help message of '--name' for baymodel-create

This patch corrects help message of name option for baymodel-create.
Typo: 'bay' -> 'baymodel'

Change-Id: I7ab80fe19110fd3dfec2c3084311d7d11e3bce51
Closes-Bug: #1519199

commit_message:
Pass creds into the clients.Manager() in functional tests

Because of some changes in tempest now it is nesessary to
set credentials to the client.Manager()

Change-Id: I37e95118064317797dc3277ce79b195a8ebd328b

commit_message:
[install] changed the note because it restarts two services

The current note says that only Apache HTTP service is
restarted by systemd command. However, the command actually
restarts both Apache HTTP service and memcached service.
Therefore, the note should be changed that the command restarts
each service.

Change-Id: Ie11da97213103d3b740cfce7c5e4a08aa5d48294
Partial-Bug: #1467994

I'm in favor of this but at the moment don't recall that we have a model for doing these with plugins, although it should be possible with what we have."}, {'account_id': 7350, 'date': '2015-06-10 16:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The easiest way would be to create a plugin that would just add a file inside the lib/cinder_backends directory.

But I think most of the vendors have a wrapper around devstack(-gate)? so they could copy their file into lib/cinder_backends before devstack is executed.'}, {'account_id': 7715, 'date': '2015-06-12 09:40:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I agree with the patch if the plugin maintainers accept the proposal.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2015-06-16 18:16:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

so, honestly, I'd like to see one of these folks do this with an external plugin first, so we can point to an example. Maybe I can con jgriffith into that."}, {'account_id': 7350, 'date': '2015-06-17 13:05:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There"s more than 40 vendor drivers in Cinder, each of them is required to have a working CI so apparently some folks manage to have everything working without the need to inject their stuff into DevStack.

Here the question is: how come some vendors are allowed in and some are not ? I guess it's for historical reason, but then the question becomes for how long will we support that ?'}, {'account_id': 2861, 'date': '2015-06-25 12:29:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Where can we have these configurations? I am planning to add volume migration tests to tempest and I need those configuration for different back ends. 
Is there any Bp, link, work in progress ? Or nothing, but throw them like rubbish.'}, {'account_id': 2861, 'date': '2015-06-25 12:32:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I like to see things constructive but not disruptive. Unless there is decision about where to put these plugins.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2015-06-25 15:40:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

All but one of the files being removed here are purely iniset calls, which can be done in local.conf directly, no plugin required.

The exception is the netapp nfs plugin and it simply adds a cleanup function that unmounts any mounted nfs volumes, which is only used by unstack.sh and/or clean.sh.'}, {'account_id': 7350, 'date': '2015-08-18 14:10:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Some more people just lost some more time:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177677/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/214194/'}, {'account_id': 7350, 'date': '2015-11-24 16:08:57.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Clearly this is not a priority. I still don't understand why we chased people using extras.d hooks but we are fine with this living in devstack."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-02 15:25:01.000000000', 'message': "Remove closed source cinder backends

If we want to encourage people to use externally hosted plugins for devstack
we should make no exception.

Cleaning up devstack was discussed at Vancouver (see
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-QA-Devstack-Roadmap)

I don't want to be hard on the competition here, but people are confused. (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186807/ and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177677/)

Change-Id: I07502173a8c6941d463615f6d7e2d057b98a17e0
"}]
commit_message:
Remove closed source cinder backends

If we want to encourage people to use externally hosted plugins for devstack
we should make no exception.

Cleaning up devstack was discussed at Vancouver (see
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-QA-Devstack-Roadmap)

I don't want to be hard on the competition here, but people are confused. (see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/186807/ and
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/177677/)

Change-Id: I07502173a8c6941d463615f6d7e2d057b98a17e0

commit_message:
Fixing issues spotted in dev environment

- removed own kafka abstraction in favour of monasca-common
- removed monasca keystone context filter, not actually used
- changed URI of logs endpoints to /v1.0/log/single

Change-Id: Iaceabdce2b2862451cfe63d2a612577d7710022b

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 13:40:02.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure designate-manage reads config before policy

With the designate-manage command, the policy file is read before
the configuration is parsed.

If the policy file is in a non-default location, all designate-manage
commands would fail.

Change-Id: Ic1e37c18cc61732db8df0d59cdb687b0167d63c0
Closes-Bug: 1519356

commit_message:
Ensure designate-manage reads config before policy

With the designate-manage command, the policy file is read before
the configuration is parsed.

If the policy file is in a non-default location, all designate-manage
commands would fail.

Change-Id: Ic1e37c18cc61732db8df0d59cdb687b0167d63c0
Closes-Bug: 1519356

[{'created': '2015-09-24 17:35:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix race condition in V1 Records API

When listing records in the V1 API, two calls to central
are made - once for records once for recordsets - if the
content of either changes between the two calls, a failure
can occour. Instead, we already have all the data we need
so use it from the recordsets rather than make two calls

Change-Id: Ic43d7e8c0d60267ec4788b63ed5f7e88e7bbe625
Closes-Bug: 1487934
(cherry picked from commit eea5c1e8ad55d7ec17bf4695ba63efbc0e170784)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition in V1 Records API

When listing records in the V1 API, two calls to central
are made - once for records once for recordsets - if the
content of either changes between the two calls, a failure
can occour. Instead, we already have all the data we need
so use it from the recordsets rather than make two calls

Change-Id: Ic43d7e8c0d60267ec4788b63ed5f7e88e7bbe625
Closes-Bug: 1487934
(cherry picked from commit eea5c1e8ad55d7ec17bf4695ba63efbc0e170784)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-09-28 19:22:24.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure CNAME RRSets only have one record

Throw a 400 error back at the user if they try to create a CNAME
RRSet with more than 1 record.

Closes-Bug: 1486743
Change-Id: I252fcd046dc902ff28162d831c0c0fd6b0dea3d2
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure CNAME RRSets only have one record

Throw a 400 error back at the user if they try to create a CNAME
RRSet with more than 1 record.

Closes-Bug: 1486743
Change-Id: I252fcd046dc902ff28162d831c0c0fd6b0dea3d2

[{'created': '2015-09-24 17:41:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix #1494799 handle limit=max on v2 and Admin APIs

Handle mixed case "max", raise ValueError on unexpected strings
on v2 and Admin APIs.
Add unit tests.

Change-Id: I2cf8d11bd2f4bc4bdff9d67812f6eb7437eb59ae
Closes-bug: 1494799
(cherry picked from commit 8277e964db038399e1d1e2df6e6a92a4e1c4cbbe)
'}, {'created': '2015-10-01 14:44:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix #1494799 handle limit=max on v2 and Admin APIs

Handle mixed case "max", raise ValueError on unexpected strings
on v2 and Admin APIs.
Add unit tests.

Change-Id: I2cf8d11bd2f4bc4bdff9d67812f6eb7437eb59ae
Closes-bug: 1494799

commit_message:
Fix #1494799 handle limit=max on v2 and Admin APIs

Handle mixed case "max", raise ValueError on unexpected strings
on v2 and Admin APIs.
Add unit tests.

Change-Id: I2cf8d11bd2f4bc4bdff9d67812f6eb7437eb59ae
Closes-bug: 1494799

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-10-01 14:49:19.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure blacklists complete in a reasonable time

Add a timeout around the blacklist regex matching, ensuring
that regex patterns and subjects which would otherwise take
many minutes to match return in a resonable time

Change-Id: Ideb184518b46fee6e4770f227204eb0f41413f4a
Closes-Bug: 1497031
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure blacklists complete in a reasonable time

Add a timeout around the blacklist regex matching, ensuring
that regex patterns and subjects which would otherwise take
many minutes to match return in a resonable time

Change-Id: Ideb184518b46fee6e4770f227204eb0f41413f4a
Closes-Bug: 1497031

All code that is not in the "the-big-rename" topic will be getting this procedural -2.
More information can be found here: - http://graham.hayes.ie/posts/the-big-rename/
On Friday 2015-11-13 this -2 will be removed, and code review as normal will continue.

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-24 14:36:23.000000000', 'message': "Fixed history parameter having no effect on search

The history parameter wasn't passed to _get_pagination_options.
_get_pagination_options was adding a ? to the generated url parameters,
but the search was already doing it.

Change-Id: Id98dae88a090c14111eb3c9f31e41c10d9fc8fd1
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed history parameter having no effect on search

The history parameter wasn't passed to _get_pagination_options.
_get_pagination_options was adding a ? to the generated url parameters,
but the search was already doing it.

Change-Id: Id98dae88a090c14111eb3c9f31e41c10d9fc8fd1

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-12 14:43:08.000000000', 'message': 'test stable gnocchi branch

currently, the integration test will always test against
gnocchi-master. this means the gnocchi-stable branches are never tested.
this changes integration test to test the appropriate gnocchi-stable
branch corresponding to the stable releases of ceilometer and aodh.
with each gnocchi-stable release, the corresponding ceilometer|aodh
stable target may need to be adjusted.

Change-Id: I0d78d2268b87a5aaaae21b6d8712003b2e990417
'}]
commit_message:
test stable gnocchi branch

currently, the integration test will always test against
gnocchi-master. this means the gnocchi-stable branches are never tested.
this changes integration test to test the appropriate gnocchi-stable
branch corresponding to the stable releases of ceilometer and aodh.
with each gnocchi-stable release, the corresponding ceilometer|aodh
stable target may need to be adjusted.

Change-Id: I0d78d2268b87a5aaaae21b6d8712003b2e990417

commit_message:
Set puppet DIB_INSTALLTYPE in tripleo.sh not toci_instack.sh

Currently we override the puppet modules to build from source for CI
but that leads to tripleo.sh being broken for developers wanting to
set up a local environment matching what's in CI.

So, instead rely on tripleo.sh to setup the right version based on
the branch (e.g master or stable/liberty based on STABLE_RELEASE)

We still set up puppet.env so the DIB_REPOREF data is setup correctly
when we depend on an under-review puppet change.

This depends on the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246447/ change to
tripleo.sh (merged for master tripleo-common), not using
Depends-On or this change will be blocked on the (not merged) liberty
patch.

Change-Id: Ia7615d7f6293e4a220e0121dbb5ea095b3bb5275

commit_message:
Noop tests update

* Refactor "globals yaml" feature
* Add "task facts" feature
* Add tasts for the master node tasks
* Improve "status debug" message
* Many minor fixes

Closes-bug: #1517481

Change-Id: I6cb36ac45c75a3f4371580744007a3225bc0ec8e

[{'created': '2015-11-18 14:45:33.000000000', 'message': 'Bug fix while editing actions with missing keys

If a key is not present in the database, the panel failed to open the modal
windows for edition, this fix that by using the dict.get()

Change-Id: Ic5f5e216828f10d41f288408fc5109dc004c6ab9
'}]
commit_message:
Bug fix while editing actions with missing keys

If a key is not present in the database, the panel failed to open the modal
windows for edition, this fix that by using the dict.get()

Change-Id: Ic5f5e216828f10d41f288408fc5109dc004c6ab9

commit_message:
[contributor] Change RST inline markup conventions

:program:` ` markup is not widely used at our docs.
This convention become an inconsistency.
Also, this markup doesn't help translators.

Some discussion on docs mailing list:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-docs/2015-November/007892.html

Change-Id: I7efd24efc626ebfc5d73a2f23a1ee5e7ddfc00a4

commit_message:
[Spec] Support for external plugin dashboard links in Fuel UI

* this commit describes a first part of the blueprint
  about plugin entries on environment dashboard

Related to blueprint external-dashboard-links-in-fuel-dashboard

Change-Id: I1bb1c0887eea79424657520378179df72d61b1bb

This enable keystone_endpoint to match a service which are different
only by type and not by name.

This should be required as the puppet service type can now be specified
using "name::type".  But a deprecation period is required because making
this a requirement breaks all existing code.

And it is possible because no code is currently using the new service
syntax but stick the keystone_service { 'name': type => 'mytype'}

commit_message:
Keystone_endpoint match service by name/type.

This enable keystone_endpoint to specify the type of the service
matched.  This way one can match services which are different only by
type and not only by name, like services nova/compute and nova/computev3
for instance.  It does so by fetching the _id_ of the service when it
has the type information instead of just using the name.

This should be required, and deprecation has been added, as the current
code work only because of a convention.

Change-Id: I9ea20fbad274d583485bc09a52b9df8000eb1af5
Closes-Bug: #1506996

This is the only thing that's worked for me so far: manually remove all C libraries, manually remove old pyeclib, reinstall requirements, reinstall swift, then it works

https://gist.github.com/notmyname/7ce9b2a5da133bcaf610"}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2015-10-23 19:20:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I reset to the state of master, then upgraded pyeclib, then manually moved the updated liberasurecode libraries from /usr/lib to /usr/local/lib, and everything works!

So I think the problem with upgrades is that the new liberasurecode is installed into /usr/lib instead of /usr/local/lib (where it used to go) and /usr/local/lib takes priority. The old version is used, and things break.'}, {'account_id': 7485, 'date': '2015-10-25 01:05:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi John/Kota, the issue should be addressed by the new PyECLib dot release (1.1.1) - no changes to liberasurecode version.  If PyECLib installs liberasurecode, it always installs to /usr/local/lib.

This change should be good with the new PyECLib rev.  Will get docs updated and let the package maintainers know so we can get the .deb packages included on the Jenkins slaves.'}, {'account_id': 7485, 'date': '2015-10-25 07:56:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-10-25 08:30:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified-1

simple test of "clean and reinstall from master" followed by a "upgrade to thing patch" seems to make everything work just fine.

I end up with 2 copies of liberasurecode in /usr/local/lib. Both 1.0.7 and 1.1.0, but the newer was used (ie the tests all pass with this pass locally after the upgrade).


So what's up with the CI system that makes this break?'}, {'account_id': 7485, 'date': '2015-11-06 21:26:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Pending global-requirements bump:  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238771/


I think Kota needs to revert his -1 before the requirements core can okay.'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2015-11-06 21:31:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

the global requirements patch is still for 1.1.0. That needs to be bumped to 1.1.1, right?'}, {'account_id': 7485, 'date': '2015-11-06 21:45:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi John, the original idea was to keep the global requirements at 1.1.0 given the debs and rpms are already available for that release and the upgrade issues don't exist.  But I went ahead and submitted the 1.1.1 change now - will make sure I send a note to Zigo and Zaitcev to make sure packages are built."}, {'account_id': 9107, 'date': '2015-11-09 16:49:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I'm not sure that it works to update PyEClib to 1.1.1 in global requirements and *then* update Swift to support PyEClib 1.1.1. It looks like updating PyEClib in global requirements fails because Swift still requires PyEClib 1.0.7. See discussion at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238771/

Would it be possible to detect at runtime if PyEClib supports liberasurecode_rs_vand? If yes, it should by used by default when available, or fallback to jerasure.

It would allow to have a smoother transition from PyEClib 1.0.7 to 1.1.1.

Maybe supporting PyEClib < 1.1 (without liberasurecode_rs_vand) can be temporary?"}, {'account_id': 7485, 'date': '2015-11-09 18:59:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Upon discussion with lifeless and mordred on -infra, here is the proposal:

1) up global-requirements to >= 1.0.7, leave upper-constraints at ==1.0.7, 

2) up swift requirements to >=1.0.7, 

3) up global-constraints.txt on master to >=1.1.1 and upper-constraints to ==1.1.1,

5. update swift requirements with >=1.1.1 and remove jerasure_rs_vand from EC_TYPE_REFERENCE (introduced by patch 243316)"}, {'account_id': 7485, 'date': '2015-11-10 20:15:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

commit_message:
EC: Use ec_type=liberasurecode_rs_vand in unit tests

To minimize external library dependencies for Swift unit
tests and SAIO, PyECLib 1.1.1 introduces a native backend
'liberasurecode_rs_vand.'  This patch is to migrate over
the unit tests and swift.conf sample to the new ec_type.

This change ups the PyECLib requirement to >=1.0.7 as an
intermediate step to the upgrade to >=1.1.1:  Upper
constraint for CI is at ==1.0.7 at the moment and unless
Swift is updated to >=1.0.7, it (and global-requirements)
cannot be updated to >=1.1.1.

Related SAIO doc changes are part of a separate patch.

Change-Id: Idde727f855aeecc7da7570a4af3656af6bdbc779

commit_message:
Add region support to nova providers

Nova providers did not previously have region support, so things like
the host aggregate provider do not work as expected in a multi-region
environment. This change mirrors what puppet-neutron's providers do,
they use the nova_region_name setting, this uses neutron/region_name.

Change-Id: I1d5bddbe977352b0458115ab77b8129311b63453
Closes-Bug: #1517220

commit_message:
Include devstack-trusty nodes for OSA role jobs

This includes the devstack-trusty node pool as an option for the
OpenStack-Ansible role jobs to allow the functional jobs to
execute.

Change-Id: I6b2c11a3eea635494fb6490f09365b3c721e8487

- gate-keystone-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/32/190532/1/check/gate-keystone-specs-python27/8884afb/ : SUCCESS in 1m 44s'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2015-06-11 08:29:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Do you have any idea how we want to do this? are you thinking of breaking extra out into a new user_id, key, value table?'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2015-06-11 08:37:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

What's the plan for if the schema changes whilst there is data in the database? are we validating on output as well? would we need to support htings like default values?"}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2015-06-11 10:30:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2015-06-20 17:33:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

so this appears to be a total U turn from the approach I thought we discussed in previous summits/midcyle to NOT make keystone a generalised storage bucket.  If we really have decided that this IS the role for keystone, I'm not necessarily against that....it's just that this is a major change of course."}, {'account_id': 5538, 'date': '2015-06-22 18:24:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Please see comments inline. Looks like this is going to add too much of complexity to many Keystone APIs..'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2015-06-23 15:39:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(5 comments)

@rushi,

Most of your concerns are related to the extra data implementation that already exists. This is about providing a way to minimize what is allowed as "extra" attributes since we cannot do away with them.

@Henry,

Since we cannot remove the "extra" attributes, and optionally making them "turned off" will never happen (because they are turned on by default and the feature is used), we should address the many requests we have for "my special use-case top level attribute that needs to be indexed". Short of versioning the API and dropping "extras" completely, I think this is one of the only solutions that pushes people towards properly defining and validating what goes into "extra". 

I also want to move to a point where we have clear validation on anything going into the DB, not just "everything except whatever you added in because you felt like it". This also mitigates the problem where a user could be malicious and shove a ton of data onto each object they can update/add and cause DB bloat / IO issues when talking to the DB.'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2015-07-15 19:23:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-07-15 20:01:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-keystone-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/32/190532/2/check/gate-keystone-specs-docs/5b9298c//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 38s
- gate-keystone-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/32/190532/2/check/gate-keystone-specs-python27/6a28dfb/ : SUCCESS in 2m 22s'}, {'account_id': 5707, 'date': '2015-07-17 10:31:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I think this is the only logical place we can go!  I also like the fact that, once this become not optional, a deployer could prevent the storage of any extra attributes if that was their wish'}, {'account_id': 6804, 'date': '2015-07-23 15:43:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6460, 'date': '2015-07-25 03:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

This looks like a nice enhancement to help tame the wild west of extra attributes'}, {'account_id': 1941, 'date': '2015-07-30 04:04:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Love the idea!

I know there are some operators that customized horizon to manage the extra fields, this will be handy for them to enhance the searching capability in the UI.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2015-07-31 05:48:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2015-08-03 00:57:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2015-08-03 04:50:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Not a fan of requiring this but the spec looks fine. 

I'll be interested to see how we implement this - i don't want to have a CRUD interface for uploading jsonschemas."}, {'account_id': 13055, 'date': '2015-08-26 17:45:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2015-08-28 04:15:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

Needs to address Jamie's comment."}, {'account_id': 13997, 'date': '2015-08-30 03:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Morgan, thanks for the patch. Just a minor comment inline for your future patchset.'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2015-11-24 15:17:58.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
validating/indexing extra attributes

Add the specification for handling validation and indexing/searching
based upon the extra attributes for the many different resources that
keystone manages/consumes.

Change-Id: Ic0b8327e144b169e441edf3b3a18b72a019fd03e

commit_message:
No longer support configuring keystone under eventlet

This change removes devstack support for deploying keystone under
eventlet. This change should be merged as soon as development for
Mitaka has started (the stable/liberty branch has been cut) on
devstack.

Change-Id: I023ccc649c7ce674931ad638c6dd0d4c38a31e19

[{'created': '2015-06-18 09:57:42.000000000', 'message': "Make acl_scenarios tests' keystone cache work with keystonemiddleware 2.0

Token cache keys in keystonemiddleware 2.0 are sha256 hashes of the
token key. This is _not_ the case in keystonemiddleware <2.0. This
change adjusts the FakeMemcache to support both types of key.

Change-Id: Idcba48b227e8921a67f5af27f723810704ae790b
"}, {'created': '2015-06-18 09:58:47.000000000', 'message': "Make acl_scenarios tests' keystonemiddleware cache work flexibly

Token cache keys in keystonemiddleware 2.0 are sha256 hashes of the
token key. This is _not_ the case in keystonemiddleware <2.0. This
change adjusts the FakeMemcache to support both types of key.

Change-Id: Idcba48b227e8921a67f5af27f723810704ae790b
"}]
commit_message:
Make acl_scenarios tests' keystonemiddleware cache work flexibly

Token cache keys in keystonemiddleware 2.0 are sha256 hashes of the
token key. This is _not_ the case in keystonemiddleware <2.0. This
change adjusts the FakeMemcache to support both types of key.

Change-Id: Idcba48b227e8921a67f5af27f723810704ae790b

commit_message:
Set attribute 'is_locked' of cluster as public

Removed the duplicated logic to calculate the cluster
is locked or not from UI.

Change-Id: I642015bf687b7135a2bea4a0494b453565b3d43f
Partial-Bug: #1519050

commit_message:
Dynamically find the extra partitioned block device

This provides support for using loopback devices for the extra
disk.

Change-Id: Ia61b32e27ba619d15860daa6a9ed75291dad1d06

commit_message:
Convert gate to Ansible setup

To support multinode we must now distribute our setup to multiple
hosts. Instead of making special rules for this, we are going to
convert our existing setup to Ansible. This way both setup proceedures
take place in the exact same fashion.

Partially-Implements: blueprint multinode-gate
Change-Id: I43ece298bba994e9b5083403ef3cf6d4245cda6d

commit_message:
Xenapi: Handle missing aggregate metadata on startup

If the host added using aggregate function to slave host in
Xenserver environments, nova-compute does not start
because cannot get aggregate metadata information.

Co-authored-by: John Haan <yongiman@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Yoon Doyoul <ydoyeul@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Michael Still <mikal@stillhq.com>

Change-Id: Idc979d7b3a974f7f9f61e6cd3485bd7a7e0879ea
Closes-Bug: 1413475

commit_message:
dyn-gen-physnet-set functions

Implement generate_bridge_mappings
Implement generate_physnet_vlan_ranges

CI disable, because next patch in the chain has valuable CI check.
Only functions located here. no calls.

Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: I0cfd3d38ab62d07216e767e391109fcac74691b4
blueprint: dyn-gen-physnet-set

Heh. Looks like for services API, but now this option is not presented in API documentation http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-identity-v3.html#endpoints-v3'}, {'account_id': 8289, 'date': '2015-11-19 07:03:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Maybe the doc is not latest:)

https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/v3/endpoints.py#L35
https://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/v3/endpoints.py#L62
ttps://github.com/openstack/python-keystoneclient/blob/master/keystoneclient/v3/endpoints.py#L98'}, {'account_id': 6577, 'date': '2015-11-19 07:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

ok. I see, but I'd like to hold this patch till landing docs or changes for client. I don't think, that we should use some "unofficial" API.
IMO, it's not good, when user can not find any documentation about new option and he needs to research code.'}, {'account_id': 6577, 'date': '2015-11-19 07:53:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

P.s. I will be happy to +2 it, if you upload patch for updating API docs for keystone and make this patch as depends-on'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2015-11-19 08:39:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@Sergey,
IMO, we should not wait the api docs to be fixed before we implement any feature. It would be good, if we can update the api docs too. However, we should not block on that.'}, {'account_id': 6577, 'date': '2015-11-19 08:45:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

@Rabi: I understand your point, but we can not know, when API doc will be fixed - may be in the next release and as result we use some undocumented API (p.s. also this option may have some restriction mentioned in the doc, which we don not take in account right now).
I can remove my -1, if get confirmation about this option from keystone team or will see patch for documentation.
P.s. it's my opinion - any other core-reviewer can approve it ;)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-23 09:11:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1

commit_message:
Add 'enabled' property for keystone endpoint

Allow user to determine whether the keystone endpoint
appears in catalog.

Change-Id: I2056555db2ae715ca8ff1d3d4c6846adef375a73
Closes-Bug: #1505165

Tom raised a good point that as good practice, we don't want to loose information by raising a new exception. This is especially true if the exception is to be processed by other code.  It would be good if we can add information to the existing exception and re-raise it.  However, this is a simple case in a unit test and the exception should happen at the top level.  So it's probably OK for this particular case."}, {'account_id': 8143, 'date': '2015-11-24 05:35:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7049, 'date': '2015-11-24 05:36:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18386, 'date': '2015-11-24 06:04:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12053, 'date': '2015-11-24 08:08:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12175, 'date': '2015-11-24 08:53:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(5 comments)

Its mostly the raising of the minimum version, I think?'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2015-11-12 12:14:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6608, 'date': '2015-11-12 12:24:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-nova-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/53/232053/9/check/gate-nova-specs-docs/0a05ccd//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 4m 24s
- gate-nova-specs-pep8 http://logs.openstack.org/53/232053/9/check/gate-nova-specs-pep8/2daf587/ : SUCCESS in 1m 59s
- gate-nova-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/53/232053/9/check/gate-nova-specs-python27/6bef206/ : SUCCESS in 2m 10s'}, {'account_id': 7461, 'date': '2015-11-12 13:48:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Good Paul. I noted a couple of trivial nits, they do not need to be fixed unless you need another patchset anyway.'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2015-11-17 12:06:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

This will be a huge win for both maintainability and usability. I'm concerned about the potential for a severe performance regression, though, which would go unnoticed unless we were proactive about looking for it. I think we need to put in a performance test plan, with pre-defined limits of acceptable transfer performance. If libvirt doesn't do sparse detection on transfer, and after a quick look it seems it doesn't, there are going to be some use cases which suffer a severe performance degradation over rsync. We should be explicit in what we decide to do about these cases, e.g.:

1. Tough: that's how it is now. We'll improve it when libvirt allows.
2. Retain an rsync option for copying between storage pools.
3. Document and suggest affected users don't use storage pools."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2015-11-17 12:42:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

So, the way Nova uses qcow2 is that it calls fallocate to allocate the maximum possible size of the qcow2 file. So the distinction between raw & qcow2 doesn't apply - all files are going to exhibit sparseness regardles of format.

What Matt says about virStorageVolUpload/Download is correct, in that they do not detect sparseness, so are likely to be much slower than rsync on sparse volumes.  It is possible to enhance libvirt to add support for sparse detection, which we should explore upstream, which ought to get it on a par with rsync in terms of sparse handling.

For the sake of upgrades, we *must* keep support for rsync around for at least 1 more cycle, with a deprecation warning. Based on the performance implications of libvirt API though, I think we'd need to keep rsync around as an option until the libvirt handling of sparse files is improved.

There are people today who refuse to deploy rsync due to the need for ssh access to the compute hosts. They would likely accept the libvirt storage pool impl, despite the performance comparsion with rsync, since they currently have no viable solution at all.

So on that basis I think

 - This proposal to add use of libvirt storage pools is acceptable as an option in nova
 - We should engage with libvirt upstream to improve performance
 - We must keep rsync support around until libvirt offers comparable performance"}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2015-11-17 12:52:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2015-11-17 12:54:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

A filed a bug against libvirt to request better sparse handling

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1282795

Please reference ths bug in the spec.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2015-11-17 12:54:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 7461, 'date': '2015-11-17 16:48:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

The performance issues that Matt and Dan bring up above were discussed in the Live Migration subteam meeting. We agreed with Dan's proposal: 
- add storage pools option, 
- keep rsync option, 
- organise work on upstream libvirt to address performance issues.

We do not want to depend on anything that has not already been implemented in libvirt, but in this case the important aspect is the feature itself. Some users will not do rsync at all so we are giving them an option even if a slow one. We can organise work on libvirt copy performance if no one else does."}, {'account_id': 14131, 'date': '2015-11-17 20:23:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6608, 'date': '2015-11-19 18:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
Migrate libvirt volumes

This spec proposes using built-in libvirt volume transfer
methods to transfer libvirt volumes between compute nodes,
in order to facilitate cold migrations and resizes.

Spec for blueprint migrate-libvirt-volumes

Depends-On: Idc8e919627e2e01c2fa4599f15c9e2de614f41c3

Change-Id: I7b55d36e390207e7fea7e5ec75ccd29573850579

(3 comments)

Fix wrong concat fragment for httpd conf.

Nice hack by the way.  As it's impossible to hook into the wsgi vhost definition, you cannot use the standard directory, with location provider that apache::vhost offers (https://forge.puppetlabs.com/puppetlabs/apache#parameter-directories-for-apachevhost)  which is sad but for which I cannot see a easy fix.  So, nice hack :)"}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2015-11-10 18:45:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 50:

(5 comments)

The fragments were not included in the vhost conf du to a too high order.  You can use template instead of multiple fragments.

Puppetlabs' apache module has some provision for the shibboleth module, you can use the apache::mod['shib2'] but cannot use the directory helper as you cannot inherite/override easily in puppet. (You can but's it's kind of unused). You can still see what they are doing and include that in your template if this is relevent."}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2015-11-10 19:25:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 51.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-10 20:07:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 51: Verified-1

(4 comments)

On centos, nothing is changed on apache side, so it's "working".  On ubuntu the code is installed and run on apache but the module is not enabled, triggering the problem.

I think that, in this case, you should enable the redhat repo and let the ::apache::mod do its jobs on redhat plateform as well.  This will make the module works out of the box for everyone.

if you take the short way (not enabling redhat repo), then you have:
 - let the user know that it has to install the mod and configure apache for the conf to work (sic!)
 - put the class { 'apache::mod::shib': } in the "debian" block.

I really think this would be an inferior choice, though.'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2015-11-11 00:55:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 52:

[{'created': '2015-08-25 17:55:11.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Support for Keystone as Service Provider

This patch implemts the class to configure Keystone
as a Service Provider

-This patch cover only Keystone as SP for K2K
 (Protocol is SAML and module is Shibboleth)
-Install required packages
-Configure keystone.conf file
-Restart keystone
Note: Keystone should be running over apache.

Change-Id: I32a1487c7674605124e6d0b182fe38ea4b58de87

2- Install Shibboleth
3- Reconfigure the selected Keystone VirtualHost on Apache.

On RedHat based systems:

commit_message:
Support for Keystone as Service Provider

This patch implements the class to configure Keystone
as a Service Provider. It covers only Keystone as SP
for K2K (Protocol is SAML and module is Shibboleth)

On Debian based systems:
1- Configure keystone.conf
2- Install Shibboleth
3- Reconfigure the selected Keystone VirtualHost on Apache.

On RedHat based systems:
1- Configure keystone.conf
2- Reconfigure the selected Keystone VirtualHost on Apache.
Note: Step 2 will only execute if the user have add the extra repository
or installed shibboleth.
(About the extra repository, see:
https://wiki.shibboleth.net/confluence/display/SHIB2/NativeSPLinuxRPMInstall)

Implements: blueprint enabling-federation
Change-Id: I32a1487c7674605124e6d0b182fe38ea4b58de87

commit_message:
xen: mask passwords in volume connection_data dict

The connection_data dict can have credentials in it, so we need to scrub
those before putting the stringified dict into the StorageError message
and raising that up and when logging the dict.

Note that strutils.mask_password converts the dict to a string using
six.text_type so we don't have to do that conversion first.

SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ic5f4d4c26794550a92481bf2b725ef5eafa581b2
Closes-Bug: #1516765
(cherry picked from commit 8b289237ed6d53738c22878decf0c429301cf3d0)

Needs some clarification whether we have to do this in Senlin. Maybe it makes more senses to push this code to SDK?

Another related question is why this logic lives in the client side instead of the server side? In the long run, it would mean that novaclient (or in this case, senlincient) can never go away.

I did a simple search on nova server code. Maybe the following line is the server side support to this?

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#n766

If we are not sure about the situation, and we are not sure that we are doing the right thing, maybe we should raise a question in the -dev mailinglist? For example, we can ask for suggestions whether network update is possible via nova API; if it is impossible today, is there plan to migrate that to server side; we can articulate our intent to skip novaclient for this kind of requests.'}, {'account_id': 11034, 'date': '2015-11-10 01:35:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

Understand, will try to clarrify this issue with Nova guys before moving on.'}, {'account_id': 11034, 'date': '2015-11-16 03:41:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi, Qiming, although I didn't get resp from mailing list, I talked with alex_xu in irc channel about this question. He said they choose to provide atomic option in Nova API to give user more flexibility to control the interface status of a server. They think clientside should be responsible to integrate operations like interface detaching, attaching, network definition change comparison to provide convenience for enduser. So they don't have the plan to put entire interface updating logic to Nova service side. But if the updating is for replacing a interface in error status with a healthy one, it makes sense to them. So I guess they have different understanding from us on the server interface update API. Or we can try to push it to SDK? But IMHO, SDK behaves more like a mapper rather than a client, so I'm not sure mixing several API interfaces together to build a new function call which doesn't have counterpart in service side makes sense to them."}, {'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2015-11-16 03:51:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

Great. Thanks for communicating with the nova team. Their feedback makes senses to me. If that is the decision, we can only handle this from 'client' side."}, {'account_id': 11034, 'date': '2015-11-17 09:46:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-17 10:14:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified+1

I'm a little concern about this patch, it might fail at following case.

create a server with networks: {'network': a, 'fixed-ip': xx.xx.xx.xx} then after created, it will have a port. let's assume the port id is 'aaa-bbb' , then update this server with networks: {'port': 'aaa-bbb'}. The existing port should not be removed.

I haven't test it yet, if I'm wrong please correct me..."}, {'account_id': 11034, 'date': '2015-11-24 02:14:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hi, Ethan, I think that case won't happen since user should verify a port is not being used before using it to update a server's network. Reattaching a port that has been attached to a server will obviously failed since it is not a valid operation supported by Nova."}, {'account_id': 7404, 'date': '2015-11-24 03:13:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

OK, that sounds a good reason to me, +1 for this patch. commit_message:
Enable update of network properties for nova server profile

This patch adds support for network properties update for
os.nova.server profile type. To update the network definition
of a nova server cluster/node, user can create a new profile instance
with 'networks' spec property changed and then use this new profile
to update cluster/node.

Change-Id: I9f4c8143b543fd689e4c095175753ed353aaa494
Implements: blueprint support-nova-server-update

commit_message:
Drop some outdated information from our quick start guide

* Only tox has to be installed via pip, everything else is in virtual
  environment. Nose is no longer used.
* One should NOT run other tox commands in an existing tox environment.
  This is not how tox is intended to be used, and it cause weird failures
  or seemingly random virtual environment rebuilds.
* Drop statement about running unit tests on a clear VM. Not sure where it
  comes from, only tox and setuptools are required to run unit tests,
  and they don't mess with system packages. Only leave note about devstack,
  as people seem to have problems with it.

Change-Id: Ie7d0172b66231cfd8f9c4f8f2d76604a187443b0

commit_message:
[image-guide] Fix Debian image download text

The text was one year old, before the release of Jessie.
This patch gives a bit of refresh.

Change-Id: I80d7039569dcec7e82e403984550fa1c13ad2e7e

subject: sql sharding support
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 6537, 'name': 'gordon chung', 'email': 'gord@live.ca', 'username': 'chungg'}, {'_account_id': 6794, 'name': 'Simon Pasquier', 'email': 'pasquier.simon@gmail.com', 'username': 'simon-pasquier'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 11819, 'name': 'Chaoyi Huang', 'email': 'joehuang@huawei.com', 'username': 'joehuang'}, {'_account_id': 13560, 'name': 'Rohit Jaiswal', 'email': 'rohit.jaiswal@gmail.com', 'username': 'rjaiswal'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2015-06-30 22:32:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-07-01 00:14:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-ceilometer-specs-docs http://docs-draft.openstack.org/56/197356/1/check/gate-ceilometer-specs-docs/ae4e963//doc/build/html/ : SUCCESS in 2m 46s
- gate-ceilometer-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/56/197356/1/check/gate-ceilometer-specs-python27/8081b8b/ : SUCCESS in 2m 19s'}, {'account_id': 11819, 'date': '2015-07-01 01:20:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Two comments for the BP'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2015-07-01 08:24:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Are we really adding more work in something we want to deprecate in the next cycles? :('}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2015-07-02 14:11:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@jd, we're currently testing out the feature. initial tests appears to make the sql backend a very viable solution and that it can handle large loads efficiently (significantly better than mongo backend)

the code is relatively straight forward so if the tests prove useful i think it might be a good easy win for those who don't use latest/greatest."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2015-07-02 14:50:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

This seems legit but I share some of jd's concerns about spreading our development resources too thin.

Also if we're really going to do I wonder if the sharding handling needs to be configurable or even pluggable. project_id and resource_id mostly make sense but as pointed out above that will lead to queries across multiple shards when querying for multiple resources. Different installations may want different sharding policies.

On the one hand making it configurable allows choice, but tyranny of choice is a huge problem with the stuff, so it might be best to just have the best default."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2015-07-02 14:56:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

What I'd like is to have that built in something handy that we can use with Gnocchi :)"}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2015-07-06 19:40:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

i believe all the functionality is available in sqlalchemy already (not very flexible but it's there)

regarding resources, yes, it is another work item to cover but do we say no to a resource we would never have to begin with? ultimately, the requirements of users are what will drive resources/development (ignoring those just doing research)."}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2015-07-08 14:08:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 13560, 'date': '2015-07-17 19:43:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Does sqlalchemy sharding supports replication across the databases, i.e. having more than one copy of the shard for a set of data? i.e replica shards.

At least for mysql backend, any scheme we use will need to support HA, multiple copies of the data of different databases, and be compatible with Percona clustering.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2015-07-21 12:46:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

discussion with Rohit,

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ceilometer/%23openstack-ceilometer.2015-07-17.log.html#t2015-07-17T19:51:18 

we probably want to look at something with richer sharding support'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2015-11-24 14:14:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Fix Spark installation fails when parsing spark-env.sh

Change encoding to UTF-8 for each line in file.

Change-Id: Icbcb2ab80bceac6fe0b2bb09c84c2cd7c1027252
Closes-Bug: #1510588
(cherry picked from commit c84316aa82a2604e15c8d0a3795b788994edfe18)

commit_message:
Neutron: add logging context

Added instance information to logs. This provides more context
regarding failures and helps with debugging.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I2b6699e3d85a710be8c437286994f9b3075f3076

commit_message:
Make some classes inherit from NoDBTestCase

TestWSGIService and RootwrapDaemonTesetCase in
test_service.py and test_utils.py can be NoDBTestCase
because of no db access.

Change-Id: I8a9e400a6e9f342a4b0570457825d1209e87000d

commit_message:
Remove unneeded 'self' in plugins.cdh.v5_4_0.plugin_utils

Should be no 'self' when using super to call method. Just remove it.

Change-Id: I2e0e6cf5efbe35b0f9d1b8a216160ce231cfda0a
Closes-bug: #1517851
(cherry picked from commit 84457eed830f0c0a80fcfc856332a191b91b096a)

commit_message:
[Upstream training] Update TC member list

this commit removes the screenshot on slide 3 and inserts
two screenshots for all the current TC members on slide 4.

commit_message:
Wrong entity name for Host Aggregate resource

The entity name is used by resource.
This cause unable to show or delete the aggregate.

Change-Id: I9efb75fb91e66a47968b9248385afc37cbd04f26
Closes-Bug: #1519230

inside a clouds.yml configuration file. A default configuration has

from the `openrc` file currently being templated.

The default configuration can be specified using the following:

openstack --os-cloud default <command>

inside a clouds.yml configuration file. A default configuration has

commit_message:
Implement OpenStack client clouds.yml configuration file

OpenStack client supports defining one or more sets of credentials
inside a clouds.yml configuration file. A default configuration has
been created named `default` that contains the same admin credentials
from the `openrc` file currently being templated.

The default configuration can be specified using the following:

openstack --os-cloud default <command>

Change-Id: I62ac6fad7165cb07c551cdcf503e50ccd3cd3a56

commit_message:
[8.0][builder] Fix LP group feature

   Disable grouping by commit-message tags `(closes|partial|related)-bug`
   Change gerrit-topic group trigger from `bug/N*` to `group/N*`

Change-Id: I7b40410eb7ac8257d47e691401893b941889a317
Closes-Bug: #1517090

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-21 02:57:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix HTTP error codes due to invalid templates

This reverts commit 9a4d719ea1a6ca63f527b5c78308fd288058d42b and creates a
new exception type, InvalidGlobalResource, that is raised when a
non-existent template is referenced in the global environment and which
results in an HTTP 500 error.

This fixes the cases where we could return 404 or 500 errors as a result of
template validation failures, when we should return a 400 error.

Change-Id: I3c7b3182957448bb13514696cc2e12f5aaddd253
Closes-Bug: #1518458
Related-Bug: #1447194
'}]
commit_message:
Fix HTTP error codes due to invalid templates

This reverts commit 9a4d719ea1a6ca63f527b5c78308fd288058d42b and creates a
new exception type, InvalidGlobalResource, that is raised when a
non-existent template is referenced in the global environment and which
results in an HTTP 500 error.

This fixes the cases where we could return 404 or 500 errors as a result of
template validation failures, when we should return a 400 error.

Change-Id: I3c7b3182957448bb13514696cc2e12f5aaddd253
Closes-Bug: #1518458
Related-Bug: #1447194

commit_message:
Refactor the test for Fuel Master migration

Refactor the test to use template based approach:
- refactor the test to use template driven engine;
- add a new nodes config - 1 controller + 1 compute;
- add 2 new test configs - for VLAN and VXLAN net. providers
that use the new '1 controller + 1 compute' nodes config.

Change-Id: I586103f144bab73aa69b4239944ddf128919202b
Closes-bug: #1512677

[{'created': '2015-11-24 03:57:33.000000000', 'message': "remove unnecessary mock for rpc server start

latest oslo.messaging 3.0.0 requires invoking start() first then stop()
can be called, but we've mocked the start() which will hang the process
then finally raise TimeoutException.

This patch removes unnecessary mock for rpc server start(), and bumps
oslo.messaging to align with global requirements.

Change-Id: If22df56a3b3af1e62b9f29fa1be1276d7cf7776d
Closes-Bug: #1519182
"}]
commit_message:
remove unnecessary mock for rpc server start

latest oslo.messaging 3.0.0 requires invoking start() first then stop()
can be called, but we've mocked the start() which will hang the process
then finally raise TimeoutException.

This patch removes unnecessary mock for rpc server start(), and bumps
oslo.messaging to align with global requirements.

Change-Id: If22df56a3b3af1e62b9f29fa1be1276d7cf7776d
Closes-Bug: #1519182

commit_message:
As discussed with Shuquan, I applied some changes:

* Retrieved subnet & mask bits (IPv4 & IPv6) from a new value in tempest conf file
* Check if the mask bits is not too small

Change-Id: I60e29f307c7932c4b5b3f121a166521e21d2a737
Closes-Bug: #1514457

Clay, thanks for the comment. The following info are the results of grep with the keywords in swift repository.

- _keystone_identity method

$ find . -name \*.py -print | xargs grep _keystone_identity | grep -v _integral_keystone_identity
./swift/common/middleware/keystoneauth.py:        identity = self._keystone_identity(environ)
./swift/common/middleware/keystoneauth.py:    def _keystone_identity(self, environ):
./swift/common/middleware/keystoneauth.py:        # _keystone_identity. The purpose of keeping it in this release it for
./test/unit/common/middleware/test_keystoneauth.py:    def test_keystone_identity(self):
./test/unit/common/middleware/test_keystoneauth.py:        data = self.test_auth._keystone_identity(req.environ)

- environ['keystone.identity']

$ find . -name \*.py -print | xargs grep "keystone\.identity"
./swift/common/middleware/keystoneauth.py:            environ['keystone.identity'] = identity
./swift/common/middleware/keystoneauth.py:        # In next release, we would add user id in env['keystone.identity'] by'}, {'account_id': 12193, 'date': '2015-07-22 00:23:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I wrote above info on paste.
http://paste.openstack.org/show/397691/'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2015-07-28 14:21:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I have previously noticed this 'backwards compatible code that we'll delete soon' comment. So I did some archeology:

The comment is introduced here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22820/11..12/swift/common/middleware/keystoneauth.py

looks like it is in response to a review from Chmouel about having thrid party middleware that depended on the environ var. I went back to folsom-eol and cannot find anything in swift repo that uses the keystone.identity environ key.

The backwards compatibility was discussed in this meeting:
http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/swift/2013/swift.2013-06-12-19.01.log.html

with no real conclusion IMHO :P

I'll add Chmouel to review and ping him to see if he still needs the compatibility. Of course, others may since have become dependent :/"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2015-07-28 17:20:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@acoles - great digging!

@ho something like that is what's required to *start* the conversation about getting rid of compatibility cruft.

... and also why it's almost never worth it to turn over the rock unless it is *seriously* causing some sort of maintainability nightmare."}, {'account_id': 12193, 'date': '2015-08-05 09:00:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Alistair, thanks for the info!

I think there are two points. One is remove keystone.identity from environ another one is a content of keystone.identity whether v3 token related info includes or not.
As for the first one, I will follow the previous discussion so I will keep it.
As for the second one, if we keep keystone.identity in environ, it means we support keystone.identity so it's better to update a content with v3 token. I will submit a patch for it soon."}, {'account_id': 12193, 'date': '2015-08-05 09:01:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-08-05 10:25:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

commit_message:
Remove _keystone_identity method

_keystone_identity method has been maintained for backward
compatibility. But there is no place to use it now so this patch
replace _keystone_identity method to _integrated_keystone_identity
method as _keystone_identity.

Change-Id: I9464c047401f92ae31a5d3bb7aacaeb0624150e0

    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Gal suggested that we should not restart ovn services and etcd on script startup.

He advised that we should keep up running service and start only missing services.

Eran will be happy to get your opinion.

Best regards,
Yuli'}, {'account_id': 13070, 'date': '2015-11-22 16:15:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Its a good idea 
It makes sense not to restart all the core services on every rejoin.

So you will check status on the OVS services and the DB driver services.

It means you will have to extend the drivers (DB ) to support status check
Make sure to implement the status check to all the supported DB drivers devstack scripts'}, {'account_id': 18903, 'date': '2015-11-23 14:24:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-23 14:49:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Verified+1

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-21 09:24:52.000000000', 'message': 'Abstract environment template catalogue.

Continuing with the environment template catalog blueprint,
which allowed to define complex architecture for applications,
 an abstract environment template catalog can be included.
It involves the existence of an environment template catalogue independent on any user, which can be customized by anyone to include their concrete information (e.g. keypair). Concretely, it involves all the operations to manage environment templates (creation, deletion, updating), plus the customization done by the user. At the end, the customized environment template can be lanched and converted into an enviornment

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/murano/+spec/abstract-env-template

Change-Id: I702d9d707cb14195278b1cc2084fe9609660a3fe

commit_message:
Public environment template

This feature will allow having private and public environment templates, as well as,
to obtain all public templates from all tenants. In addition, a clone functionality
is added to copy a template from a tenant to another.

Change-Id: I702d9d707cb14195278b1cc2084fe9609660a3fe
Targets-blueprint: abstract-env-template

python-mistralclient is already listed in global requirenments.
This patch moves it above and removes the comment

commit_message:
Let cluster-update return 400 if profile not found

This is part of a series of patches that correct the returned status
code when some referenced object cannot be found when performing
operations on some entities.

Change-Id: I74c595deff1784f24f27d1c810df08faf10bebc5
Partial-Bug: #1518209

commit_message:
Change admin IP ranges in tests for node groups

Change default IP addresses range for admin/pxe network
in system test for multiple cluster networks feature.
Check that DHCP range is configured properly and Nailgun
doesn't allocate excluded from range IPs to nodes.

Change-Id: I64069e287a6970b93931d93212efb0c1712af40a
Closes-bug: #1513154

commit_message:
Add 'mutable' param to Opt

re: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/mitaka-cross-project-dynamic-config-services

oslo.config already offers a reload_config_files method. This patch adds
a 'mutable' flag to Opt, allowing services to mark which opts may be
reloaded. It also adds a flag to ConfigOpts, 'limit_mutation', to say
that when reload_config_files is called, only mutable opts should be
changed. If a new value for an immutable opt is detected, a warning is
issued.

Change-Id: I719874b58e64bc4f8535c85da43670779fbfd380

commit_message:
Make snapshot-name argument positional

Make "snapshot-name" argument mandatory
to avoid misunderstandings

Change-Id: I59a5723b8630068af8d947ea8903b007f98071c0
Closes-Bug: #1461079

commit_message:
Let cluster-create return 400 if profile not found

This is part of a series of patches to come that fix the return status
code of the HTTP API request. When referenced objects (not the entity
itself) is not found, we should return 400 (bad request) instead of 404
(not found).

Change-Id: I14a2dfed744ca41a1f288d14fe052c698f223827
Partial-Bug: #1518209

commit_message:
Fix with-items concurrency greater than the number of items

If the list provided to with-items has length less than the value provided
in concurrency, the engine throws an exception index out of range.

Change-Id: Ib9425f00a735c2fa09b685486aff02511094d991

commit_message:
Remove preprov provider dependencies from CONF

This commit removes the last dependencie of the preprov
provider from CONF. The required configuration is passed
now as parameters at init time.

As the number of parameter grows, and many of them are taken from
configuration, adding dicts with parameters that can be used
when instantiating the credentials providers.

Depends-on: I0ca0b96fc618ffe60851984a9c6d46b0507878d4
Partially-implements: bp tempest-library
Change-Id: I945994580ce9a29f6fbf67183e5da4b100542386

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-13 14:48:58.000000000', 'message': '(WIP) Block services on public network

Refactors firewall rules to create source
based rules that only permit connections
from the management network for most services.

The only services that should have public access
are Horizon and OpenStack APIs. And from those,
nova metadata and nova VNC should only be
accessible internally. All other services should
accept connections from private or storage
networks.

New defined type openstack::firewall::multi_net
accepts firewall definitions with an array of
source networks.

Removed unneeded openstack::firewall::allow class.
Obsoleted openstack::firewall:vnc defined type.

Change-Id: Ie63c01dcbd0bbd9adf17363b0db0b0a99b837b4e
Closes-Bug: #1514014

'}, {'created': '2015-11-16 16:14:15.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor firewall to listen on only on internal networks

Refactors firewall rules to create source
based rules that only permit connections
from the management network for most services.

The only services that should have public access
are Horizon and OpenStack APIs. And from those,
nova metadata and nova VNC should only be
accessible internally. All other services should
accept connections from private or storage
networks.

New defined type openstack::firewall::multi_net
accepts firewall definitions with an array of
source networks.

New function prepare_firewall_rules creates a hash
of firewall rules coming from an array of source
networks.

Removed unneeded openstack::firewall::allow class.
Obsoleted openstack::firewall:vnc defined type.

Change-Id: Ie63c01dcbd0bbd9adf17363b0db0b0a99b837b4e

commit_message:
Refactor firewall to listen on only on internal networks

Refactors firewall rules to create source
based rules that only permit connections
from the management network for most services.

The only services that should have public access
are Horizon and OpenStack APIs. And from those,
nova metadata and nova VNC should only be
accessible internally. All other services should
accept connections from private or storage
networks.

New defined type openstack::firewall::multi_net
accepts firewall definitions with an array of
source networks.

New function prepare_firewall_rules creates a hash
of firewall rules coming from an array of source
networks.

Removed unneeded openstack::firewall::allow class.
Obsoleted openstack::firewall:vnc defined type.

Sorted parameters on openstack::firewall and added
docstrings

DocImpact: TBD

Change-Id: Ie63c01dcbd0bbd9adf17363b0db0b0a99b837b4e
Closes-Bug: #1514014

commit_message:
Networks tab does not show external configuration

When you create a network you can specify it as
external network. When the network is listed
in Horizon 'Networks' tab we do not see any
column indicating if network is 'external' .
It is nice to enhance the network tab to add a
new column showing 'external' indicating whether
network is 'external'.

Change-Id: I5cbd612b47f842fcb669b72ee4bf076ccd554356
Close-Bug:#1350237

commit_message:
msgpackutils: drop Python 2.6 support

We doesn't support python 2.6 now, this commit
removes Python 2.6 related code in module msgpackutls.

Change-Id: Id148239ee6c1ad461188fa38b06ca0d7913d7454

[{'created': '2015-11-18 15:42:47.000000000', 'message': 'Align requirements to liberty global-requirements

Now requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt are
aligned to global-requirements.txt of stable/Liberty.

commit_message:
Align requirements to liberty global-requirements

Now requirements.txt and test-requirements.txt are
aligned to global-requirements.txt of stable/Liberty.

Testing requirements are now move to test-requirements.txt
from tox.ini

Also the author, author-email and home-page are now update to
reflect Freezer Team and openstack-dev ml.

Change-Id: I27f2ea875778f19d2ffb542b9b8fbf29d1a740fe
