commit_message:
Refactor function configure_default_route

Before the function configure_default_route was a little part of function
generate_network_config which changed default gateway only, due to the provider
for interfaces was not picked correctly.
Now if default route is needed to change we just modify network_scheme
and call generate_network_config with this network_scheme, if no - do
nothing.
Leave only provider lnx as default for l23_stored_config.

Change-Id: I33e88550af5d5cce2886254444ee5d450e578a1c
Closes-bug: #1510072

commit_message:
Allow filtering using unicode characters

Current code forces the filter arguments to be converted
to a byte string using str() which prevents filtering
using unicode characters. This patch fixes that.

Change-Id: I3abef5da4c2614806011440a4443e869920b4afd
Partial-Bug: 1472999

commit_message:
Allow a plugin to use custom swift role name

Plugins may define custom role names. If no custom role are defined,
the default one are used.

Partially implements: blueprint detach-components-from-controllers
Change-Id: Iae606c2db13a79161b45bcb00a401a6a239d90d7

subject: Example about composite namevar possibilities.

commit_message:
Example about composite namevar possibilities.

As the new interface offer more possibilities, this patch provides
comprehensive examples on how it can be used.

Change-Id: I3d00db94575f2d64fc7cd7f0ff493f9885dc6db9

commit_message:
Fix default domain.

After the move to composite namevar a problem could occur if another
module was using indirection to find resource by name.

If the manifest didn't have any
keystone_user/keystone_tenant/keystone_user_role definition, then, the
'Default' domain would be appended to the name.

This patch, fix that by simplifying the rule for calculating the default
domain.

It now strictly follows what is described there https://review.openstack.org/#/c/219127/

Change-Id: Ic2efb51fe76d055307c8c27fa79015764417160b
Closes-Bug: #1517187

commit_message:
Add parameters to nova

    Added options:

	api_paste_config
	fping_path
	allow_resize_to_same_host
	use_local
	live_migration_flag
	block_migration_flag
	multi_host
	auto_assign_floating_ip

Change-Id: I4665344bb0049fe2b7080c2f4dbca01e011f4f1d

commit_message:
Fix "provider ovs_redhat7 is not supported"

Leave only lnx as default provider for l23_stored_config for RHEL7

Change-Id: Ic3cd97cb226b803a8978323738f386031a8f0db3
Closes-bug: #1518930

commit_message:
Bump RAM to 1G for ironic-inspector IPA job

This is in line with what Ironic IPA job requires, and this is the most
likely cause of current gate failures. Lower VM count to 1 to reduce
load on infra.

Change-Id: I742410a961aec807980443110ebe97673e7359a6

commit_message:
Switch Ansible role jobs to use 'dsvm-functional-trusty'

This patch switches the Ansible role checks to use the
'dsvm-functional-trusty' job so that it has sudo access.

Change-Id: Ic8d6afd2d72ac8d6bd4290a39a57ec6d8706207b
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Log error instead of exception trace

In impl_vsctl we rather use LOG.error instead of
LOG.exception. In these case the exception trace did not provide
any valuable information.

Change-Id: Ia02f000d460b3aee72a31e9963e5d0e0d4c68315
Closes-bug: #1518429

commit_message:
Floating IP range support in Nova network

This patch provides a possibility to add
ip ranges of networks (i.e.: 192.168.1.210-192.168.1.224)
to a floating ip pool.

Depends-On: I802280e4e2912c9aed1c10d519ead84b1f22f900

Change-Id: Iffb0af32753708decb8d2b60f1075b66f7520553

commit_message:
remove python26-jobs from remaining oslo libraries

The Oslo team is dropping python 2.6 support for all libraries. Many
already have the jobs removed, but a few didn't. This patch cleans up
the remaining libraries, except pbr which has to continue to be tested
with 2.6 until all of its consuming projects have dropped 2.6 support.

Change-Id: I516356b4d2e39c092acc667c8f493f02a3050a19

commit_message:
Add a few dummy scenarios

Add dummy scenarios on rps and constant runner to check that thread in which
they executing would terminated by runner timeout.

Change-Id: If9be9b9413b735c5538e0e57edabab26f1134a08

repositories in preparation for the upcoming release

commit_message:
Add hosted agents list to dhcp agent scheduler

Availability zone aware dhcp scheduler uses hosted agents list
to schedule dhcp agent to proper availability zone.
The scheduler can avoid scheduling the same availalibity zone as
agents host a network which should be distributed for HA.

Change-Id: Ib01f6d852956dc1e89b83321d657c0baf829e28a
Partially-implements: blueprint add-availability-zone

commit_message:
Fix congress ENABLED_SERVICES

Previously there were spaces after commas when assigning
to ENABLED_SERVICES.

This version eliminates those spaces.

Change-Id: Iccfced704bd7e3c4c52f81bbbf3836d27854ef40

hongbin, I found this method in testcase base class:

def addOnException(self, handler):
"""Add a handler to be called when an exception occurs in test code.

        This handler cannot affect what result methods are called, and is
        called before any outcome is called on the result object. An example
        use for it is to add some diagnostic state to the test details dict
        which is expensive to calculate and not interesting for reporting in
        the success case.

        Handlers are called before the outcome (such as addFailure) that
        the exception has caused.

        Handlers are called in first-added, first-called order, and if they
        raise an exception, that will propogate out of the test running
        machinery, halting test processing. As a result, do not call code that
        may unreasonably fail.
        """

I don't test if it works, I think it's better to register a handler(copy_logs) when exception happened 
instead of do copy_logs while tearDownClass() every time.

Eli.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2015-11-19 21:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2015-11-19 21:47:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
Record diagnostic info from bay nodes

In functional tests, copy logs from bay nodes to host before the
tests tear down. The bay node logs could be helpful for
trouble-shooting.

Change-Id: I102d2ce37c2253c743719e4ccf978c23a92a3a3f

commit_message:
Support single test

Support to run single test, e.g.
tox -epy27 -- -n senlin.tests.unit.profiles.test_nova_server
Change-Id: I1bc36a624b7cfced3aba721bfeeb780c3b5e3214

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 14:57:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix resource tracker VCPU counting

The resource track is double counting the number of
vcpus used because it counts the virt driver's view
and the resource tracker's view. It should reset
the count to 0 before counting the resourcet racker's
view. this is done for other resources (memory, disk)
in _update_usage_from_instances().

This was not caught in unit tests because they always
provide a virt driver view with no resource used for
tests that assume instances are already running.

This patch adds the reset to 0 and modifies the
tests to provide correct counts of used resources
from the virt driver.

Change-Id: I21acfd7d5b5ed442cd1e9049c986a06bd2b59b81
Closes-Bug: #1519001
"}]
commit_message:
Fix resource tracker VCPU counting

The resource track is double counting the number of
vcpus used because it counts the virt driver's view
and the resource tracker's view. It should reset
the count to 0 before counting the resourcet racker's
view. this is done for other resources (memory, disk)
in _update_usage_from_instances().

This was not caught in unit tests because they always
provide a virt driver view with no resource used for
tests that assume instances are already running.

This patch adds the reset to 0 and modifies the
tests to provide correct counts of used resources
from the virt driver.

Change-Id: I21acfd7d5b5ed442cd1e9049c986a06bd2b59b81
Closes-Bug: #1519001

commit_message:
Add jobs related to gating/publishing (API) docs

It is important to make users aware of the senlin APIs. It is also
important to publish the docs for users and developers. We need to
figure out how to do it (in the community way) and get it done once the
API is stabilized.

commit_message:
Use o.vo VersionPredicateField

As of o.vo 0.8.0, VersionPredicateField has been added, so nova can get
rid of its copy and use o.vo's

Change-Id: Iedc76a04ea31f1e575cdfebd0e5ab7ea18fac3d6

commit_message:
Add 'global_project' option for cluster-list

This patch adds an option '-g'/'--global-project' to the 'cluster-list'
command so that an admin user can list clusters from all
tenants/projects.

Change-Id: I9fac64f1e81a6d4e61a93d57a1272d175e8b61e0
Depends-On: Icab38c970de7704c3134afd1b96a03b3670bd2ad

[{'created': '2015-11-24 04:09:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix authenticate method in sdk driver

Transport module is removed from pythonopenstacksdk. This patch
revises authenticate method in senlin sdk driver to adopt to this
change.

Note: this is just a workaround before the following patch is in
formal openstacksdk release.

Change-Id: Icae406bada98c21601f7a26d30ad4311f57ea90a

commit_message:
Fix authenticate method in sdk driver

Transport module is removed from pythonopenstacksdk. This patch
revises authenticate method in senlin sdk driver to adopt to this
change.

Note: this is just a workaround before the following patch is in
formal openstacksdk release.

Change-Id: Icae406bada98c21601f7a26d30ad4311f57ea90a

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 03:25:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix cluster-list api inconsistency

This patch fixes the API parameters for cluster-list call. The
parameters 'project', 'parent', 'user' are removed to be consistent with
node-list API call. We can add these parameters later when requested.
This patch adds real support to 'global_project' for cluster-list, which
was defaulted to 'True' before.

Change-Id: Icab38c970de7704c3134afd1b96a03b3670bd2ad
Closes-Bug: #1465924
"}]
commit_message:
Fix cluster-list api inconsistency

This patch fixes the API parameters for cluster-list call. The
parameters 'project', 'parent', 'user' are removed to be consistent with
node-list API call. We can add these parameters later when requested.
This patch adds real support to 'global_project' for cluster-list, which
was defaulted to 'True' before.

Change-Id: Icab38c970de7704c3134afd1b96a03b3670bd2ad
Closes-Bug: #1465924

[{'created': '2015-11-23 11:21:54.000000000', 'message': 'Enable "openstack server resume" command to take multiple servers.

Current "openstack server resume" command could only resume one server.
Improve it to be able to handle more than one servers. Also improve
the doc to reflect the new feature.

Change-Id: I726eb86bfa3df3a9911f45770e6641264dbc1e0b
Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers
'}]
commit_message:
Enable "openstack server resume" command to take multiple servers.

Current "openstack server resume" command could only resume one server.
Improve it to be able to handle more than one servers. Also improve
the doc to reflect the new feature.

Change-Id: I726eb86bfa3df3a9911f45770e6641264dbc1e0b
Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers

commit_message:
Enable "openstack server suspend" command to take multiple servers.

Current "openstack server suspend" command could only suspend one server.
Improve it to be able to handle more than one servers. Also improve
the doc to reflect the new feature.

Change-Id: Ic0417ee28f46c9198a35744c0180342e61966b26
Implements: blueprint cmd-with-multi-servers

commit_message:
Change namespace for Nova Host Aggregate test

Change namespace to tests/openstack/nova instead of tests/nova.
Other Nova tests already move to new direction.

Change-Id: Ie8a6b2f138606666e83387a1eace604b5f18beb8

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-10 16:46:32.000000000', 'message': "Convergence: Avoid sync point delete for stack CREATE

Previous traversal sync points should be deleted in case of concurrent
updates. However, in case of stack CREATE there won't be any previous
traversal sync points to delete.
Hence avoid hitting the DB.

Change-Id: If61332107a1f4d70a590f7db87b6c10bc9cf7b2c

Previous traversal sync points should be deleted in case of concurrent
updates. However, in case of stack CREATE there won't be any previous
traversal sync points to delete.
Hence avoid hitting the DB.

Change-Id: If61332107a1f4d70a590f7db87b6c10bc9cf7b2c
"}]
commit_message:
Convergence: Avoid sync point delete for stack CREATE

Previous traversal sync points should be deleted in case of concurrent
updates. However, in case of stack CREATE there won't be any previous
traversal sync points to delete.
Hence avoid hitting the DB.

Change-Id: If61332107a1f4d70a590f7db87b6c10bc9cf7b2c

Change-Id: Ia0945541208fd7a8362843587f797506000479fc

commit_message:
fast8: Skip git rm'd files

Don't print error messages trying to diff files
that have been removed via git rm.

Change-Id: Ia0945541208fd7a8362843587f797506000479fc

commit_message:
Using the right format to render the docstring correctly

There are several issues in the docstring, the format is not
correct, not using the full path of class etc.

This patch corrects all of them, so the docstring will be rendered
correctly.

Change-Id: I04d5818f38b5e75b6f6197ef5e13dcd64ed91bf4

See mailing list announcement:

                2015-November/078301.html

subject: hello test
messages:
[{'account_id': 19383, 'date': '2015-11-24 05:14:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2015-11-24 05:14:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 19383, 'date': '2015-11-24 05:14:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 14817, 'date': '2015-11-24 06:10:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

the devstack plug-ins documentation

commit_message:
Fix error when using keystone v3

Need to use projects instead of tenants and roles instead of
roles_for_user when using keystone v3.

Change-Id: I78ed64555c6a7348e7576e5c5a9f354caf3338a1
Closes-bug: #1515885

commit_message:
Use YAML methods for changing Fuel 'astute.yaml'

Use load/dump methods for changing content of 'astute.yaml'
while deploying Fuel master node.

Change-Id: I71cb042927b912dd7b610cbaadca48919dafc47c
Closes-bug: #1455015

commit_message:
Remove useless LOG definitions

This change removes LOG definition:

  LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__)

in modules not needed it.

Change-Id: I16daae56d8fa5e86a7bb627e7588d0cb60dc552a

commit_message:
Manage existing: fix volume object saving

This needs an update to work with volume objects.

Currently, manage existing can fail here.

Change-Id: I9197220be201cbbb1cd8266ebb58b57641fc216f
Closes-Bug: #1518050

commit_message:
Change logic of test and add new checks

Fix issue with test change_pacemaker_parameter_not_break_rabbitmq
Expected code was changed for command 'rabbitmqctl cluster_status'

Closes-Bug: #1515983
Change-Id: I0c81989885a2ed657c5cd78dd8867b7912bf7525

[networking] Fix indent level of code block

Previously, some code blocks have unnecessary block quote
due to wrong indent level.

Change-Id: Ib06ba4f76091667d5bcd972ccf28d8a8ccb749c3

commit_message:
Skip senlin_plugin tests until bug #1519185 is fixed.

Senlinclient depends on openstacksdk and new version of
openstacksdk affects senlinclient, so skip senlin_plugin tests
for now until senlinclient fix this problem.

Change-Id: Idca1897386f0b62af0f343d78fce06fea67a4731
Partial-Bug: #1519185

commit_message:
Neutron: Clean up documentation typo

Remove duplicate SERVICE_HOST and MYSQL_HOST settings in the
examples.

Change-Id: I0e102b671f03ccb183d30ec6a762d00ebcf1e4b5

commit_message:
Make sure we return unicode strings for process output

Process output is supposed to be represented with lines, so we should
put Python strings in the queue (not bytes). Just in case, we do it only
for Python 3 environment.

To fix that, we reuse code from utils.execute() linux/windows
implementations.

This fixes the TestAsyncProcess.test_async_process_respawns functional
test for Python 3 environment.

Related-Bug: #1515118
Change-Id: I9efec2290003add44909aab33a0026372a580016

commit_message:
Use Tempest-lib's compute images_client

Compute images_client has been migrated to
tempest-lib- I495915a5a40f7d351cb69463c032281e02c907c7

Now Tempest-lib provides this client as stable interface so Tempest
should start using this from lib and remove its own copy.
Also remove its unit tests.

This commits makes Tempest to use compute images_client
from Tempest-lib.

Change-Id: I4a32fed401251a26081a052f009d9cbee86ed11f

commit_message:
API doc change for profile-update operation

This patch revises the API doc related to profile-update. We are
removing the 'spec' parameter from 'profile-update' API.

Change-Id: Icf04e8093c2c7ffcf7c318a968c7fcfd558bdd44

nit: I've seen small differences of implementation between the roles in their independent form and their current form.

This doesn't cause me a problem per se, but we need to make sure that each branch has it's final IRR counterpart if backporting."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2015-11-23 10:53:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Matt The blueprint doesn't show because it's marked as implemented: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+spec/independent-role-repositories - technically this is a follow on and implements all the specs starting with 'IRR -' in http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-specs/"}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2015-11-23 10:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

@Jean-Phillipe Some changes may be intentional updates of the readme, etc... but if there are functional changes then we need to get reviews in ASAP to close the gap. Unfortunately during the time taken for this to merge there may have been some other patches merged here causing divergence.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2015-11-23 11:17:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

I've reviewed the diff for master, and kilo between the independant version of the roles and the in-code version. Except the additional needs of the IRR (like the testing parts), the diff is only cosmetic: Changes in READMEs or in License files.

For me, it's a go. And all the roles are already ready for a possible backport into Liberty, because these roles didn't change at all (if I'm not wrong) between the master and liberty (and even kilo!).

nit: I've seen a .DS_Store somewhere in an independant repo, maybe we should this in a .gitignore in another addition?"}, {'account_id': 7307, 'date': '2015-11-23 11:54:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 7217, 'date': '2015-11-23 13:40:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
IRR - Implemented for setup-hosts

The change removes and points our role requirements to use
the independent repos that are now online. Updates to the
Ansible bootstrap script here remove the forced "updated"
that was happening on every bootstrap so that we're ensuring
a stable build based on a described version.

Change-Id: If7f83d0875a5b074f506235d650be48a6e461e56
Implements: blueprint independent-role-repositories
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-22 14:05:50.000000000', 'message': "Remove confusing note

The note saying that services other than Identity assign meaning to
roles is confusing. I can't figure out what it means. Maybe the
intent was to say that the other services have a policy file that
defines what operations the roles can do. Before the v3 API, keystone
didn't support RBAC, but now with v3 it supports RBAC like all the
other services. Since this note is doesn't add to understanding, remove
it.

Change-Id: I9e57c4244f2e57aedc2f0dffbdf38ee07eb67473
"}, {'created': '2015-11-23 20:37:13.000000000', 'message': "Update confusing note

The note saying that services other than Identity assign meaning to
roles is confusing. Maybe the intent was to say that the other services
have a policy file that defines what operations the roles can do.
Before the v3 API, keystone didn't support RBAC, but now with v3 it
supports RBAC like all the other services.

The note is updated so that hopefully it will now provide usable
information.

Change-Id: I9e57c4244f2e57aedc2f0dffbdf38ee07eb67473
"}]
commit_message:
Update confusing note

The note saying that services other than Identity assign meaning to
roles is confusing. Maybe the intent was to say that the other services
have a policy file that defines what operations the roles can do.
Before the v3 API, keystone didn't support RBAC, but now with v3 it
supports RBAC like all the other services.

The note is updated so that hopefully it will now provide usable
information.

Change-Id: I9e57c4244f2e57aedc2f0dffbdf38ee07eb67473

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-21 03:05:56.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Fix wrong type of exception raised"

This reverts commit c5bb4d2ab83820f5ee2ac3fc6e8d9210e98b26ef.

Every part of this patch was wrong, except that it did (by accident)
start returning 500 errors instead of 400 errors in the case where a
template in the global environment was not found, which is actually the
operator's fault and not the user's. That's not really a serious enough
problem to justify changing it on a stable branch though, so this is a
straight revert. Luckily the patch hasn't made it into a release yet.

Change-Id: Ia3154c7c41bb69cfa2ee36eb6d48fcd339900d60
Closes-Bug: #1518458
Related-Bug: #1447194
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Fix wrong type of exception raised"

This reverts commit c5bb4d2ab83820f5ee2ac3fc6e8d9210e98b26ef.

Every part of this patch was wrong, except that it did (by accident)
start returning 500 errors instead of 400 errors in the case where a
template in the global environment was not found, which is actually the
operator's fault and not the user's. That's not really a serious enough
problem to justify changing it on a stable branch though, so this is a
straight revert. Luckily the patch hasn't made it into a release yet.

Change-Id: Ia3154c7c41bb69cfa2ee36eb6d48fcd339900d60
Closes-Bug: #1518458
Related-Bug: #1447194

commit_message:
Remove .mailmap file

.mailmap file seems to be terribly outdated, most of the lines are
comming from initial fork out of Nova. This commit removes the file.

Change-Id: Id6ca3e3d8d10612c450b3b6b3639edc1e9e52b31

commit_message:
Use new version scheme to refer to bsnstacklib

Starting from liberty, date-based versions will no longer be used
for Neutron. This fix changes neutron to use the new version scheme
to refer to bsnstacklib
In an earlier commit, bsnstacklib has been updated to use the new
version scheme. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/217896/

Change-Id: I3ba9e47681700a375508176fa5b3e3a2b170daf5

commit_message:
Rename get_server_group to show_server_group

[GET /resources] methods should be "list_<resource name>s"
or "show_<resource name>", so this patch applies the rule
to server_group client.

This patch makes tempest-lib sync for the commit of Tempest
I75307176c2f032301da6227249070c42af54dd6e, but get_server_group has
been released in tempest-lib 1.0.0 already.
So it is difficult to remove it directly for backwards compatibility
and this patch adds warning message for clarifying deprecated method.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I9e321aaf4791e8ff11e3aa114b41eb612db481ca

check hyper-v'}, {'account_id': 6524, 'date': '2015-11-22 03:10:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

This looks great but it will break networking-bigswitch, no? I would like to see the patch for the vendor repo out for review also.'}, {'account_id': 7591, 'date': '2015-11-22 05:09:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Hi Henry,

Yes, the tables were not created when neutron-server starts. The db tables have been moved to networking-bigswitch repo.  Not sure what to fix here. Need your help!

Thanks,
Kanzhe'}, {'account_id': 7591, 'date': '2015-11-22 07:02:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 7591, 'date': '2015-11-22 07:02:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Mark it WIP. Working on the vendor change to work with the patch.'}, {'account_id': 18695, 'date': '2015-11-22 10:31:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

check hyper-v'}, {'account_id': 6524, 'date': '2015-11-22 15:20:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

The models have been removed from the neutron code tree, but the DB tables are still created by alembic migrations. The migration scripts are still present (they have to stay) and the bigswitch tables are created when you run "neutron-db-manage upgrade heads".

Feel free to reach out to me on IRC if you are having trouble with this. As far as I can tell everything is OK except that the vendor repo needs to have the models and configs added now. Here is an example that I just did for networking-brocade after their models were removed from neutron: https://review.openstack.org/248415'}, {'account_id': 15882, 'date': '2015-11-23 08:22:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

check hyper-v'}, {'account_id': 7591, 'date': '2015-11-23 08:31:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

The corresponding changes in networking-bigswitch are in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/248569/.'}, {'account_id': 7591, 'date': '2015-11-23 08:31:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2015-11-23 09:51:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

I think that first the patch that you linked should land then we can review this.
In addition to this can a few people from the Brocade team chime in.'}, {'account_id': 7591, 'date': '2015-11-23 22:15:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Gary,

This patch has to go in first before the change in vendor driver can pass the unit test. The change in vendor repo fails the unit tests due to duplicate MetaData instance.

Thanks, Kanzhe'}, {'account_id': 6524, 'date': '2015-11-24 02:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Gary, this is a bigswitch decomposition, not brocade. Kanzhe Jiang is with bigswitch so that is sufficient endorsement of this patch.

When decomposing there can be circular dependencies between neutron and the vendor repo. Something will break when one of the patch lands before the other one. It is better to break the vendor repo than neutron :)

The breakage is temporary. The vendor patch https://review.openstack.org/248569 will pass when this neutron patch merges.'}, {'account_id': 6524, 'date': '2015-11-24 02:04:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 748, 'date': '2015-11-24 02:06:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-24 02:06:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Verified

commit_message:
Remove BigSwitch plugin and driver

The BigSwitch Vendor plugin and driver are in
openstack/networking-bigswitch repo and will be moved to
Openstack bigtent. This patch removes the duplicated code and
corresponding entry points. It also moves the bigswitch specific
db tables to openstack/networking-bigswitch.
Closes-Bug: #1508781

Change-Id: I180d93f3e7da347c9b042fcc3f79f19e9a471f52

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 12609, 'date': '2015-10-23 22:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2015-10-26 09:31:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

ping'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2015-11-02 16:43:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

I guess whatever we do about the character encoding can be wrong here, these are just binary streams.

The 'iso8859-1' will not raise exception at any case, it might be better option. We olso can fall back to it when the utf-8 failed, but it would be not too deterministic behaviour.

I vote -1 ONLY because you expect you can convert an arbitrary chunk of 'utf-8' encoded binary at any boundary. The system does not guarantees a 4 byte long encoded code point will be in the same chunk,
for example.: 1 byte will be in the first one and 3 byte will be in the next one.
 
It is safer to convert after a binary join, or a stream encoder needs to be used.

If none of the already existing tempest tests depends on 'utf-8' capable guest, simpler to just use 'iso8859-1' here.

But, truth is it is still too low level method to pick encoding."}, {'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2015-11-03 06:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2015-11-03 06:46:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@afazekas, I reworked tests to show my case.
I've checked it again and it still present.

iso8859-1 will not raise exception but it will not convert properly. tests show us that more suitable converter is 'utf-8' because paramiko returns data encoded in utf-8.

and because paramiko can return either bytes or str it is only one place to convert chunk before it will be joined later (with this implementation).

Maybe implementation can be changed more but I don't have cases to mock right now."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-03 07:45:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-tempest-lib-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/01/222901/6/check/gate-tempest-lib-python27/c371c9c/ : SUCCESS in 1m 10s
- gate-tempest-lib-python34 http://logs.openstack.org/01/222901/6/check/gate-tempest-lib-python34/af6e93c/ : SUCCESS in 1m 24s'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2015-11-03 21:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

On most Linux system the default encoding is utf-8 now, but it is not guaranteed. For example 'cat /bin/sh' likely fail with new encoding rules, since the output is just binary.

We cannot really expect all commands output is an utf-8 encoded text.


u'Kzs'.encode()[0:2].decode('utf-8')
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf-8' codec can't decode byte 0xc3 in position 1: unexpected end of data

As you can see if I split an 'utf-8' encoded text as the networking stack can do it any time, can lead to decoding errors.

For example io.Bytes can be used to join the binary together instead of using ''.join(chunk_array)  (see the write() and getvalue() methods)

An 'encoding' kwargs can be added to this method, with a default 'utf-8' encoding.
If the encoding explicitly None the RAW binary (bytes) should be returned and no string conversion shall be attempted.

Full utf-8 encoding MUST not be attempted for partial data. (not in this form)'}, {'account_id': 10234, 'date': '2015-11-04 18:10:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-04 19:02:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Verified+1

in python3 channel can return chunk of binary type.Then next
code tries to join all chunks with stings to result string.

This patchset has reworked algorithm. It converts all received
data to bytes, then joins data, and then converts it to string.
Separate chunks can't be converted to string because they can
contain different parts of one utf-8 char.

Closes-Bug: #1495181
Change-Id: I886c9d0c143d3553876ece7b6d1ac2df7e49d701

"}]
commit_message:
python3: converts binary data from channel

paramiko returns chunk of binary type.
So code must join all chunks with binary type and not as str.
Also this patchset adds one more parameter 'encoding' for exec
function to decode binary result to str.

Closes-Bug: #1495181
Change-Id: I886c9d0c143d3553876ece7b6d1ac2df7e49d701

commit_message:
Fix some usage for exception

Changed "except Exception, e:" to "except Exception as e:" according to
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#python-3-x-compatibility

Change-Id: Iea27b81649afc33741f8e2da9d2adf669668f816

First, I'd like to see the parts of the upgrade strategy that apply across all of Neutron and then say something like "see your plugin's documentation for further upgrade information specific to the plugin". commit_message:
devref: add upgrade strategy page

The page is intended to describe current upgrade features Neutron
supports, lay out potential improvements, describe testing strategy for
existing and planned upgrade features, and provide guidelines to
reviewers on where to look for potential upgrade breakages in proposed
patches.

Change-Id: I22e55bb2fe32b32d12fa5889b91ecb9f92b3e6a6

commit_message:
Remove unused config option image_alt_ssh_user

It's not used in the code and the corresponding
image_alt_ssh_password is no longer there so remove the option.

Change-Id: I9d3b3cd6e481edf4c1092335736acc04f1127adb

commit_message:
Move identity wait until after password is updated

With Ied83448de8af1b0da9afdfe6ce9431438215bfe0 merging, we should be waiting
after the password is updated and before we reauthenticate. This change fixes
this to be correct. For some reason a transient failure didn't cause the tests
to fail.

Change-Id: I7286085325c3578958234176adb7588afdcac578
Closes-Bug: 1473567

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-20 00:54:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix T110 violations for servers_client

servers_client contained T110 violations, and we need to fix them
before migrating the client to tempest-lib for consistent interfaces.

Change-Id: I10a8c32b53f15063dab087d67123598800b141a0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix T110 violations for servers_client

servers_client contained T110 violations, and we need to fix them
before migrating the client to tempest-lib for consistent interfaces.

Change-Id: I10a8c32b53f15063dab087d67123598800b141a0

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-zuul project

In this patch, we are just adding ansible-role-zuul into the OpenStack
gerrit workflow. After talking with both openstack-infra and third
party CI teams it was decided to deal with which team this would be
part of at a later date.

Additionally, we have not created a launchpad project for this module
or pypi (since we won't release there).

Gerritbot was also not configured at this time, since we don't know
which team we are going to be part of.

Change-Id: I6424d66fb644c938e53091da11714e3f782f9a7c
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Move get_user_by_username to common part

get_user_by_username of keystone service client is just wrapper method
and it should be moved from the client for implementing it as library.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ib44c0b2d085ef2b8f488d804c1c57e078323ce78

commit_message:
Return node.physical_id while node is creating

While node is creating, the node object has no physical_id attribution,
the patch fix it.

Change-Id: I27e9934a72dfbdcc20e6edfb635bcba6b85fae21
Closes-Bug: #1518983

commit_message:
Fix comments on DRAC BIOS vendor_passthru

This is a follow-up on "DRAC BIOS vendor_passthru: enable rebooting the
node" with change-id: Id9a87f6dec6a8d6160948e39a763134729cead99.

Change-Id: Id4c87b240b7f04368f1d6082e28d6e6105fde2c2

commit_message:
[V3] Separating groups_client from identity_client

As the qa-spec of consistent-service-method-names, we have decided
all service client modules will be separated into a single module
by each resource. So this patch separates groups_client from
identity_client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Iadb49298f41a6307d3b453b365d9b6be31b95781

commit_message:
Option for disabling wait condition feature

It looks like wait condition feature works nice
but there are some issues with that on several deployments.
Added option heat_enable_wait_condition to allow disabling of that.

Closes-bug: 1516784
Change-Id: I082ce0bb4ab8c3c939dcafc2bc821e38c5d760a7

commit_message:
Improve index page layout

Split up draft guides under separate heading and remove draft word for
easier review.

The output looks now basically like:

Generated documents
admin-guide-cloud
contributor-guide
networking-guide
user-guide
user-guide-admin

Draft Guides
arch-design-rst
config-ref-rst
image-guide-rst
install-guide-debian
install-guide-obs
install-guide-rdo
install-guide-ubuntu

Also, create separate tool openstack-indexpage that only generates index
page.

Change-Id: Ic68a674918f18dc37f8b9fa4e9d9f529a8ad131e

commit_message:
Update iLO documentation

This commit fixes the following in iLO documentation:

- Fixes some incorrect information about drivers.
- Fixes some small mistakes like s/Proliant/ProLiant,
  s/nova/Nova, s/baremetal/bare metal, etc.
- Fixes some broken HTTP links and also moves all the
  links inline (removing references like [1], [2], etc)
- Changes a reference of bash ramdisk to agent ramdisk.
- Rebrands HP to HPE. The links are not changed as of now,
  would be updated later once available.

Co-Authored-By: Ramakrishnan G <rameshg87@gmail.com>
Closes-bug: 1511224
Change-Id: I4c065ce0784e73810e9a23390d1148dc13699671

subject: WIP: Increase baremetal active and unprovision timeout to 500s

[{'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2015-11-18 02:07:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2015-11-18 02:11:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2015-11-18 02:26:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

So this is a config option, if your configuration needs more than 300 secs to boot a server then increase it in your config file.

Having a default of 500 secs is problematic because the per test timeout fixture's default is also 500sec. That means a single server build can singlehandedly use that whole window. Even if this is going to be for the gate case I think we want to handle this in local config because it seems like an abnormal situation. (although I've used "enterprise" servers they often take minutes to boot, so who knows)'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-18 03:31:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

Matt,

Where do i find this local config file?

In the mean time i am going to use this review to test whether the other gate build succeeds, so please ignore further patches to the review.'}, {'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2015-11-19 21:34:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2015-11-19 21:43:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Umm, the local config is the config file you run with. For a gate run we put it in the logs dir with the other test run artifacts. If you're only concerned about gate tests it's a devstack change (devstack generates a tempest.conf) But, it's a local config file which means anyone can make one, just like an ironic.conf.

I was simply saying changing the defaults here I don't think is the correct approach, if you need a larger timeout window that should be handled by setting a different value in the config file you use to run tempest.

If this is just a test patch, then please mark it as WIP to indicate that to reviewers"}, {'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2015-11-19 22:23:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2015-11-19 22:24:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 12640, 'date': '2015-11-19 22:31:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-20 00:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified-1

commit_message:
WIP: Increase baremetal active and unprovision timeout to 500s

The new coreos stable images takes little longer to boot and
deploy the os. When used these images results in gate timeout
consistently.

This also may help fix the issue we've been seeing that looks
like TFTP failures. One theory was that slow nodes were taking
too long to provision, but all the timeouts involved seemed
like more than enuogh. However, we totally overlooked this
particular timeout.

Related-Bug: #1393099
Change-Id: I181cd8f02e6612542841f3639a706c27aa902618

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-08-27 07:18:54.000000000', 'message': "Copy encryptors from Nova to Cinder

Currently, when creating an encrypted volume from an image, Cinder
writes raw data to the encrypted volume. When Cinder uploads an
encrypted volume to an image, it writes encrypted data to the image.
As a result, Nova cannot use these images or volumes.

To fix above problem, cinder needs to add encryptor attach/detach
layers.
This patch is the first step. It copies encryptors from Nova to
Cinder, and do following changes:
1. Add --dmcypt in end of dev name.
2. Return the new path name in attach_volume().
We can't use Nova encryptors directly as it is also used for local
LVM volumes and remote volumes.

Change-Id: I1669a58cbdf2f7bee390888301c468cbe930b11d
Partial-implements:bp encrypt-volume-with-image
"}, {'created': '2015-09-06 03:49:11.000000000', 'message': "Copy encryptors from Nova to Cinder

As a result, Nova cannot use these images or volumes.

To fix above problem, cinder needs to add encryptor attach/detach
layers.
This patch is the first step. It copies encryptors from Nova to
Cinder, and do following changes:
1. Add --dmcypt in end of dev name.
2. Return the new path name in attach_volume().
We can't use Nova encryptors directly as it is also used for local
LVM volumes and remote volumes.

Change-Id: I1669a58cbdf2f7bee390888301c468cbe930b11d
Related-bug: #1485449
Related-bug: #1482464
Related-bug: #1465656

commit_message:
Copy encryptors from Nova to Cinder

Currently, when creating an encrypted volume from an image, Cinder
writes raw data to the encrypted volume. When Cinder uploads an
encrypted volume to an image, it writes encrypted data to the image.
As a result, Nova cannot use these images or volumes.

To fix above problem, cinder needs to add encryptor attach/detach
layers.
This patch is the first step. It copies encryptors from Nova to
Cinder, and do following changes:
1. Add --encrypt in end of dev name.
2. Return the new path name in attach_volume().
We can't use Nova encryptors directly as it is also used for local
LVM volumes and remote volumes.

Change-Id: I1669a58cbdf2f7bee390888301c468cbe930b11d
Related-bug: #1482464
Related-bug: #1465656

commit_message:
Avoid to use `run_once`

Sometimes `Starting * bootstrap container` task doesn't work due to
behavior of `run_once` and `when`.
When `run_once` is used, this task will execute on "the first host",
as defined by inventory, in the group(s) of hosts targeted by the
play[1].

If "the first host" doesn't meet "when" condition, `Starting * bootstrap
container` task will skip.
So we must avoid using with 'run_once' and 'when'.

[1]: http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/playbooks_delegation.html#run-once

Change-Id: I8b0a7a643d76793f17445568d1eea86a16485c8d
Closes-Bug: #1517774

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-19 18:40:54.000000000', 'message': "Handle glanceclient CommunicationError in horizon

When glanceclient throws a CommunicationError,
Horizon doesn't show the error message from the exception
handling code because the exception type CommunicationError
is not recognized.

This change registers the exception type and
adds a unit test case.

Change-Id: I5c6f3df4097a4493b4c88716f30de86e4cde3b4b
Closes-Bug: #1517652
"}]
commit_message:
Handle glanceclient CommunicationError in horizon

When glanceclient throws a CommunicationError,
Horizon doesn't show the error message from the exception
handling code because the exception type CommunicationError
is not recognized.

This change registers the exception type and
adds a unit test case.

Change-Id: I5c6f3df4097a4493b4c88716f30de86e4cde3b4b
Closes-Bug: #1517652

steps for cue-monitor verification.

* Stop the first two nodes in the cluster
* Verify VM's have stopped
* Wait until Cluster status goes to 'DOWN'

commit_message:
Extending cluster create tempest test

Extending existing cluster create tempest test to include additional
steps for cue-monitor verification.

The additional steps include:
* Stop the first two nodes in the cluster
* Verify VM's have stopped
* Wait until Cluster status goes to 'DOWN'

Change-Id: I6095b2460e24539bd0d8fd8629bce4b73955ccb1

commit_message:
Split instance details and source in Launch Instance wizard.

Per user feedback, the existing wizard step, Select Source,
is being split into two steps - Instance Details and Select Source.

Partial-Implements: blueprint launch-instance
Change-Id: I3bf2c6dc8baea782416e608965459cce0aee69f6
Co-Authored-By: Coleman Beasley <cbeasley@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Kyle Olivo<keolivo@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Errol Pais<epais@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Matt Borland <matt.borland@hpe.com>

[{'created': '2014-12-25 02:09:22.000000000', 'message': 'Option to paginate query results

The data source tables can potentially contain a huge number of rows. The
client side is unlikely going to be able to handle presenting the entire
results set to the end user without impacting performance. Use pagination to
break up the results.

Also made some indentation and title fixes to existing specs.

Change-Id: I086b23ed18d19c4387adbaaa368bede5aeba7b32
'}, {'created': '2015-01-10 04:40:38.000000000', 'message': 'Option to paginate query results

The data source tables can potentially contain a huge number of rows. The
client side is unlikely going to be able to handle presenting the entire
results set to the end user without impacting performance. Use pagination to
break up the results.

Change-Id: I086b23ed18d19c4387adbaaa368bede5aeba7b32

commit_message:
Option to paginate query results

The data source tables can potentially contain a huge number of rows. The
client side is unlikely going to be able to handle presenting the entire
results set to the end user without impacting performance. Use pagination to
break up the results.

Change-Id: I086b23ed18d19c4387adbaaa368bede5aeba7b32

commit_message:
Make the database json variable more readable

Additionally remove tty from the container cleanup docker section. It
was added in a sed in a previous patchset by serves no purpose.

Change-Id: Ib617870616bca687f72ffaa44b2e9a3a11ef1011
Partially-Implements: blueprint cleanup-playbooks

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-18 16:28:38.000000000', 'message': "IPAM: fix 'enable-dhcp' with internal driver

Commit 0c1f96ad5a6606c1205bd50ea944c3a383892cde broke the ipam
internal driver. The base plugin should only call the ipam interface
and not invoke the IPallocation data model.

Closes-bug: #1514810

WIP

commit_message:
IPAM: fix 'enable-dhcp' with internal driver

Commit 0c1f96ad5a6606c1205bd50ea944c3a383892cde broke the ipam
internal driver. The base plugin should only call the ipam interface
and not invoke the IPallocation data model.

The code that validated that the subnet had one free IP address was
removed. This would not guarantee that a port would indeed be free,
that is, a parallel operation could have created a port on the subnet
during this check.

Closes-bug: #1514810

Change-Id: I4d7ecb985762a8eef39cb2f22f210b4899f1a22e

commit_message:
Consolidate the fernet provider issue_v3_token()

When the Fernet token provider was implemented, it extended the
provider.common.py:BaseProvider class. It also overrode most all common methods
the BaseProvider implemented. Other token providers in Keystone (like the UUID
an PKI providers) just implemente a _get_token_id method because token ids may
be different across providers.

This commit removes the issue_v3_token() method from the fernet.Provider. This
ensure that the Fernet provider uses the same issue_v3_token() that all the
other token providers use.

Subsequent patches will do the same for issue_v2_token, validate_v3_token, and
validate_v2_token.

Conflicts:
	keystone/token/providers/fernet/core.py

Closes-Bug: #1515485
Change-Id: I03f56c9c84389a6d6cdb3a6863fcbfca486af337
(cherry picked from commit 91a0b29809cb71c1b2df1642d6c34a3f60a801ed)

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2015-10-08 08:36:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

jichenjc,

Thank you for your review.

You wrote:
just a question: do we need to consider remove old event records that stuck in db or let it be and when time goes on, they are gone? thanks

The reason why I would like to fix this bug is to avoid 'a foreign key constraint fails' in deleting records in 'instances' table.
The records in 'instance_actions' table must be deleted before deleting the records in 'instances' table because of the foreign key constraint.
So the records that are no longer needed had better be soft deleted.

If the VM instance is deleted, instance actions and instance actions events cannot be gotten by API.
('itemNotFound' error occurs.)
So the records in 'instance_actions' table is no longer needed after the VM instance is deleted."}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2015-10-08 10:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Thank you for your review.
I fixed it according to your suggestion.'}, {'account_id': 18695, 'date': '2015-11-13 21:03:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

check hyper-v'}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2015-11-18 16:39:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I don't think this is the right approach either TBH - we still want the event."}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2015-11-19 02:46:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2015-11-21 22:58:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-2

See this ML discussion:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-November/080033.html

And this bp spec:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/248288/

Basically we're going to hard delete instance_actions and instance_action_events when archiving/purging (hard-deleting) instances, otherwise we're not going to soft delete them.

The instance actions and events are important for postmortem analysis of deleted instances, so we aren't going to be soft deleting them with the instance. But we'll handle hard-deleting them when hard-deleting the related instances so our archive and purge code works."}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2015-11-24 00:13:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Matt,

Thank you for your review.
I will abandon this patch.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2015-11-24 00:14:14.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Add soft deleting instance actions and events

Add soft deleting instance actions and instance action events
when the VM instance is deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1336829

commit_message:
Fixed AssertionError for running tests

Since some sentences exceeded a maximum of 79 charaters,
runtests job generated AssertionError during testr like:
'AssertionError: False is not true' and 'Line limited to
a maximum of 79 characters.'

This bug fix is for running tox and for Jenkins test.

Change-Id: I6b7292f49daf57b0ba1c2663df8369a20bde5d3e

- gate-swift-python34 http://logs.openstack.org/66/245266/1/check/gate-swift-python34/e21faa9/ : FAILURE in 2m 52s (non-voting)

- gate-grenade-dsvm http://logs.openstack.org/66/245266/1/check/gate-grenade-dsvm/e449234/ : SUCCESS in 57m 49s
- gate-swift-dsvm-functional http://logs.openstack.org/66/245266/1/check/gate-swift-dsvm-functional/adccc92/ : SUCCESS in 39m 29s'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2015-11-13 22:26:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I don't understand. As long as we keep setuptools.setup(setup_requires=['pbr']...) in setup.py, it is a requirement, even if there's no literal "import pbr".'}, {'account_id': 330, 'date': '2015-11-13 22:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Pete, you're right that we still require pbr because it's in setup.py. However, setup.py and requirements.txt are parsed at different times.

setup.py is parsed at build time and requires pbr to be installed. As part of running setup.py, the stuff from requirements.txt is loaded. in fact, you need pbr to be loaded so that it knows how to parse requirements.txt.

The requirements.txt IMO should be renamed to the more accurate "runtime dependencies that are loadable from pypi". dot txt. requirements.txt is *not* a list of all of our requirements. For example, we require rsync and sqlite3, but we don't have them in that file, nor could we because you can't install them with pip.

One hint at all of this is how the global-requirements repo intentionally has one version of pbr referenced in setup.py and another version referenced in requirements.txt.

If you think all that's super confusing, you're not alone.

So requirements.txt should only be for runtime requirements that are loadable from pypi. It's a way for pip to build a virtualenv (ie for CI jobs) and maybe also a hint to packagers. Packagers still need to have the full set of runtime dependencies referenced, of course, and they will also need to have pbr in order to make swift packages. But pbr shouldn't be needed to be installed on a box running Swift.

Therefore pbr shouldn't be in requirements.txt'}, {'account_id': 5600, 'date': '2015-11-16 16:31:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18015, 'date': '2015-11-17 15:34:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

that makes sense.'}, {'account_id': 7479, 'date': '2015-11-23 18:29:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2015-11-23 20:49:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-23 20:50:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Verified

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-24 00:03:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+2

commit_message:
Update requirements

Update requirements to be with global requirement. In a separate patch, global
requirements will be updated for bot to automatically update project req.

Change-Id: I61288abdc01f6e403697a072d2c7d351f889c9d4

'}, {'created': '2015-11-19 02:46:17.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for different disk bus

Different disk bus has different device path, so we should change
our way to find device path.

examples:
virtio => virtio-5e7ef7f7-da5b-4b6c-9
scsi => scsi-0QEMU_QEMU_HARDDISK_ab5b3fab-f848-4a00-8

commit_message:
Add support for different disk bus

Different disk bus has different device path, so we should change
our way to find device path.

examples:
virtio => virtio-5e7ef7f7-da5b-4b6c-9
scsi => scsi-0QEMU_QEMU_HARDDISK_ab5b3fab-f848-4a00-8
ide => ata-QEMU_HARDDISK_e4bb1070-3ff0-4470-a

I have confirmed with my colleague who is familiar with qemu.
The device path ends with the prefix of the volume id. For example,
when the volume id is e4bb1070-3ff0-4470-ad5a-3edbb30ae011, the ide
device path is ata-QEMU_HARDDISK_e4bb1070-3ff0-4470-a. The last 20
charaters of device path is same as the first 20 charaters of the
volume id. But I can not find any official docs for it now.

Change-Id: I8fc7aa0c0f8722a24f7189c0a8c118dbb724c1d3
Partially-Implements: blueprint support-for-different-volume-type

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-17 21:40:28.000000000', 'message': "Allow in-place updates for all compatible types

We previously only allowed a resource to update in-place when the 'type'
field in the old and new templates matched. In an age of environment type
mappings, this is incorrect. Instead, allow a resource to be updated
in-place when the old and new resource plugins are of the same class, since
this is actually what determines whether handle_update is capable of
correctly updating the resource in-place.

There is a special-case for TemplateResource as we currently subclass it
for each template type, but all TemplateResource subclasses are in fact
capable of converting between each other via a stack update.

Change-Id: Iba4abf5efd9737ca6a17d8c91d5c54ab6d3f12e0
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1508115
(cherry picked from commit 98044dbd17c703e6062752f043e1cac6563e3589)
"}]
commit_message:
Allow in-place updates for all compatible types

We previously only allowed a resource to update in-place when the 'type'
field in the old and new templates matched. In an age of environment type
mappings, this is incorrect. Instead, allow a resource to be updated
in-place when the old and new resource plugins are of the same class, since
this is actually what determines whether handle_update is capable of
correctly updating the resource in-place.

There is a special-case for TemplateResource as we currently subclass it
for each template type, but all TemplateResource subclasses are in fact
capable of converting between each other via a stack update.

Change-Id: Iba4abf5efd9737ca6a17d8c91d5c54ab6d3f12e0
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1508115
(cherry picked from commit 98044dbd17c703e6062752f043e1cac6563e3589)

[{'created': '2015-11-23 22:22:13.000000000', 'message': 'Set "password" as default auth plugin

Currently, when None gets passed through a Connection, None gets sent to
keystoneauth to find the None plugin, which doesn't exist. As "password"
is the likely default, we should send "password" through unless
otherwise specified.

Change-Id: Iafe526d88a1b2ceb8b975f01dddb808f43821f0f
'}]
commit_message:
Set "password" as default auth plugin

Currently, when None gets passed through a Connection, None gets sent to
keystoneauth to find the None plugin, which doesn't exist. As "password"
is the likely default, we should send "password" through unless
otherwise specified.

Change-Id: Iafe526d88a1b2ceb8b975f01dddb808f43821f0f

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-19 01:58:14.000000000', 'message': "Add find support to BaseProxy

All other actions on the Resource class that are used in Proxy
subclasses had been exposed in BaseProxy except for find. This change
implements a simple `_find` in the base, which brings it in line with
how everything else is done, and is the last piece to get knowledge of
`self.session` out of proxy calls.

Additionally, while moving the proxy implementations to all be the same,
it's a chance to unify the find tests in the proxy. This change
eliminates the need for there to have been two test methods and makes
the tests look like how they're done for every other action.

Change-Id: Ibea01bed4e4ecd76d96021f78db0116012448984
Closes-Bug: 1517149
"}, {'created': '2015-11-23 21:43:59.000000000', 'message': "Add find support to BaseProxy

All other actions on the Resource class that are used in Proxy
subclasses had been exposed in BaseProxy except for find. This change
implements a simple `_find` in the base, which brings it in line with
how everything else is done, and is the last piece to get knowledge of

Additionally, while moving the proxy implementations to all be the same,
it's a chance to unify the find tests in the proxy. This change
eliminates the need for there to have been two test methods and makes
the tests look like how they're done for every other action.

Change-Id: Ibea01bed4e4ecd76d96021f78db0116012448984
Closes-Bug: 1517149

commit_message:
Add find support to BaseProxy

All other actions on the Resource class that are used in Proxy
subclasses had been exposed in BaseProxy except for find. This change
implements a simple `_find` in the base, which brings it in line with
how everything else is done, and is the last piece to get knowledge of
`self.session` out of proxy calls.

Additionally, while moving the proxy implementations to all be the same,
it's a chance to unify the find tests in the proxy. This change
eliminates the need for there to have been two test methods and makes
the tests look like how they're done for every other action.

Change-Id: Ibea01bed4e4ecd76d96021f78db0116012448984
Closes-Bug: 1517149

commit_message:
Switch find_disks to use a decent python lib

Now /dev/loop devices will work!

Change-Id: Icb8efe4f9bc3a21a72eb04bfd03452c26f13fd70
Closes-Bug: #1518438

and add one more explanation: "No more Stackforge

commit_message:
Changed Stackforge explanation for retirement

Since Stackforge is retiring, two slides: 'What is
Stackforge for' and 'How to add a project to Stackforge'
is not needed for training materials.

Stackforge is currently in migrating status, and
it is used before TC's decision on August 2015,
IMO it is better to keep 'Stackforge' slide.
So some content related to Stackforge was modified
with Stackforge retired and current status.

Change-Id: Ia7026acfde12d129781d90e575bb3caa3d6609aa
Closes-Bug: #1490471

export_tempest_details (responsible for generating the details file in
the stackviz-export process) had strip_details set to True, discarding
all pertinent log info necessary for a full details view. This changes
the strip_details method parameter to the default, False.

'}]
commit_message:
Edit stackviz-export export_tempest_details to save logs

export_tempest_details (responsible for generating the details file in
the stackviz-export process) had strip_details set to True, discarding
all pertinent log info necessary for a full details view. This changes
the strip_details method parameter to the default, False.

Change-Id: I293ccd15e6c0e7b1ba5f7ee9be12584e01d398b6

Oslo releases for week of Nov 23, 2015

All Libraries that have dropped py2.6 support have had
had a major version bump specified.

commit_message:
Fix for min_disk/min_ram in create_image API

If min_disk or min_ram are passed in as keyword arguments, the
values must be integers or glance hates us even more than usual.

Change-Id: I1ed04174796e12258055840e9184aa9f8bcf3ea8

The gate currently doesn't deploy with the '--use-containers' flag.

[{'created': '2015-09-10 21:11:36.000000000', 'message': "Remove shadowed ConnectionError

ConnectionError is redefined later in this module, so the original
ConnectionError isn't visible outside the module. Remove the
original ConnectionError so the code is less confusing.

Change-Id: I4898fbcc5b6300075a30f00d0313df1e4884abce

commit_message:
Remove shadowed ConnectionError

ConnectionError is redefined later in this module, so the original
ConnectionError isn't visible outside the module. Remove the
original ConnectionError so the code is less confusing.

Change-Id: I4898fbcc5b6300075a30f00d0313df1e4884abce

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2015-10-22 14:05:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't really understand what this will accomplish, except for an extra layer of indirection. The scheduler will still be dependent on getting its information fed to it from somewhere else; all this does is make that even further removed from the source, and thus more likely to be stale."}, {'account_id': 18247, 'date': '2015-10-22 18:13:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@EdLeafe Thanks for the review.

How do we go about changing the way that information is reported to the scheduler? The idea here is to provide a pluggable interface for doing that, so that we can experiment with different methods.

The pluggable interface doesn't run in the scheduler but on the compute node. If we were to create a zookeper driver for it it would provide ComputeNode information directly from the compute nodes to the zookeeper database, without passing information to the scheduler via any other means. The indirection is only in code, rather than across process or compute node boundaries.

I will re-work the specifiation to try and make the ideas more clear"}, {'account_id': 18247, 'date': '2015-10-22 18:47:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-10-22 18:52:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

Use oslo_config new type PortOpt for port options

The oslo_config library provides new type PortOpt to validate the
range of port now.

Remove Python 2.6 classifier

We have decided to remove Python 2.6 support, this commit
removes Python 2.6 classifier before dropping any Python
2.6 support in code.

Change-Id: I30a85c832dc5edb28d8e0706bb3a51caecca18ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-20 16:22:09.000000000', 'message': 'Caches Hyper-V vSwitches

Hyper-V vSwitches are queried for each port that is being bound.
There is no need to query them each time, caching them can
significantly improve performance.

Change-Id: Ibd82775f07d81599fa6d16638af351d2a70f5f4a
Partial-Bug: #1505196
'}]
commit_message:
Caches Hyper-V vSwitches

Hyper-V vSwitches are queried for each port that is being bound.
There is no need to query them each time, caching them can
significantly improve performance.

Change-Id: Ibd82775f07d81599fa6d16638af351d2a70f5f4a
Partial-Bug: #1505196

commit_message:
Move validation of compiled unit out of compiler

Instead of having the compiler do any validation on the
graph it has created instead have the compiler just compile
and have the engine that uses that compiled result do any
post compilation validation instead.

This makes it more clear that the compiler just compiles a
flow (and tasks and nested flows) into a graph, and that is
all that it does.

Change-Id: I96a35d732dc2be9fc8bc8dc6466256a19ac2df6d

commit_message:
Allow provided flow to be empty

If someone really wants to provide a flow to run that is
empty that is there prerogative so it doesn't seem that valuable
to blow up if they do this.

Change-Id: I0ad89b0ade85a64f6ec107e2686454ef6dc97353

commit_message:
Pin mime-types gem to 2.6.2 to fix CI

mime-types 3.0 requires mime-types-data gem and ruby>=2.0, which
breaks gate-fuel-library-puppet-lint job.
We can pin mime-types gem to 2.6.2 as a workaround, until
gate-fuel-library-puppet-lint is switched to ruby 2.0 environment

Change-Id: I4ee0514a72821bd6a27a5a0f068107c134e0dc60
Closes-Bug: #1518957
(cherry picked from commit aff0b7f9265480af46d1e87ee20e23a30407e191)

commit_message:
Move get_tenant_by_name to common part

get_tenant_by_name of keystone service client is just wrapper method
and it should be moved from the client for implementing it as library.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ic3f6c7aa4d69e296271c936f5ab9b188a29a2107

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-18 16:27:40.000000000', 'message': "Fix a string vs bytes issue in _guess_cgit_link

subprocess.check_output returns bytes, so we end up using '+' on a text
string (CGIT_BASE) and bytes (the output of parsed.path) in
_guess_cgit_link. Use subprocess.getstatusoutput, which returns a text
string.

Change-Id: I9e846e2192ead41ca2328b8aa20994742096c51e
Closes-Bug: #1517525
"}, {'created': '2015-11-19 14:25:21.000000000', 'message': "Fix a string vs bytes issue in _guess_cgit_link

subprocess.check_output returns bytes, so we end up using '+' on a text
string (CGIT_BASE) and bytes (the output of parsed.path) in
_guess_cgit_link. Make sure we decode 'git_remote' in Python 3.

Change-Id: I9e846e2192ead41ca2328b8aa20994742096c51e
Closes-Bug: #1517525
"}, {'created': '2015-11-23 14:06:20.000000000', 'message': "Fix a string vs bytes issue in _guess_cgit_link

subprocess.check_output returns bytes, so we end up using '+' on a text
string (CGIT_BASE) and bytes (the output of parsed.path) in
_guess_cgit_link. Make sure we decode 'git_remote' in Python 3.

Change-Id: I9e846e2192ead41ca2328b8aa20994742096c51e
Closes-Bug: #1517525
"}]
commit_message:
Fix a string vs bytes issue in _guess_cgit_link

subprocess.check_output returns bytes, so we end up using '+' on a text
string (CGIT_BASE) and bytes (the output of parsed.path) in
_guess_cgit_link. Make sure we decode 'git_remote' in Python 3.

Change-Id: I9e846e2192ead41ca2328b8aa20994742096c51e
Closes-Bug: #1517525

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-08 16:50:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for listing role assignments by project admin

Project admin fails to list role assignments for his project with
Project Scoped Token.
The issue is project admin in default policy file
(policy.v3cloudsample.json) does not have access to get details
of his project. Due to this, keystone assumes that the project
does not exist, and tries to get the project listing which again
fails.
This change updates the default policy file to let project
administrators to retrieve their own project details.

Change-Id: I025a94d23b7e4eb0a2bffd1db6da92496783264f
Closes-Bug: 1418702
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for listing role assignments by project admin

Project admin fails to list role assignments for his project with
Project Scoped Token.
The issue is project admin in default policy file
(policy.v3cloudsample.json) does not have access to get details
of his project. Due to this, keystone assumes that the project
does not exist, and tries to get the project listing which again
fails.
This change updates the default policy file to let project
administrators to retrieve their own project details.

Change-Id: I025a94d23b7e4eb0a2bffd1db6da92496783264f
Closes-Bug: 1418702

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-23 18:08:26.000000000', 'message': "Sample environment with old ServiceNetMap value

The original value for the ServiceNetMap parameter had the Keystone
Admin API service on the Internal API network. Later, it was moved to
the ctlplane network by default.

Users updating from clouds already deployed may not want to have the
service moved, and we've occassionly seen it cause issues with services
not getting restarted properly.

This sample environment file documents the old value so that users can
just optionally include it via -e to keep the services the same as they
were when they originally deployed.

Change-Id: I0b68542337a2f40e26df15fe7ac2da5aafe651d5
"}]
commit_message:
Sample environment with old ServiceNetMap value

The original value for the ServiceNetMap parameter had the Keystone
Admin API service on the Internal API network. Later, it was moved to
the ctlplane network by default.

Users updating from clouds already deployed may not want to have the
service moved, and we've occassionly seen it cause issues with services
not getting restarted properly.

This sample environment file documents the old value so that users can
just optionally include it via -e to keep the services the same as they
were when they originally deployed.

Change-Id: I0b68542337a2f40e26df15fe7ac2da5aafe651d5

commit_message:
Clean up legacy multi-version test constructs

This removes MyObj2 and MyObjDiffVers from the tests, and fixes up the
tests that still use them to use the more modern manifest-based approach,
which is much cleaner and doesn't require strangely subclassed objects
to mimic the multi-version environment during an upgrade.

It also removes a few tests that still do some basic validation on the
object registry, which is now fully contained (and tested) inside of
oslo.versionedobjects.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py

Change-Id: Ia523f3264b0ea54573e54c258efd7a07158ded36
Depends-On: Icbbb78cfcd074b0050e60c54557637af723f9b92
(cherry picked from commit 8cc7c938955dc5e5b1d2f75b249738a499aa5d79)

commit_message:
Propose taskflow release 1.25.0

There is a bug fix that is desired to be released before
the usual release next week in the set of changes from
1.24.0 to 1.25.0 so proposing a release to allow folks
that are blocked on it to be unblocked.

Change-Id: I3a56237ac42aa3252feab840fb836722ddda8b12

commit_message:
Add nested action to template tests

Add @nested_action decorator

To combine some actions into one use @nested_action for method
    which returns list of sub actions.

Implement blueprint template-based-testcases
Change-Id: Iac85df6ddaaa83ae2966d3a4e0963aa534c38877

commit_message:
release keystonemiddleware 1.5.3 for stable/kilo

the new version of keystonemiddleware will create a cap for the
python-requests library, which match the global requirements level.
this currently affect the glanceclient project, see related bug.

Change-Id: I56885745f790af5f65afac89e9150684b01b277e
Related-Bug: 1476770

commit_message:
Drop root for ceilometer

Updates to ensure commands run in the ceilometer containers
are done as the 'ceilometer' user rather than root.

Change-Id: Ic94b876a002d4413f2038c29ffdb275c68323065
Partially-Implements: blueprint drop-root

commit_message:
block hbase functional on aodh

we did not split hbase functional tests in until Mitaka so the
job should not run on liberty or it will fail.

Change-Id: I7ba71cf6ac2af923375ecebc9a801f125fc974d2

Due to recent change in neutronclient the endpoint value got changes
in following patch.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/236325/

This patch will test both public or publicURL endpoints.

Change-Id: I0dffb06c5151203e9fe2ab041a7beb028a39aac0

commit_message:
Fix the end point test for client

Due to recent change in neutronclient the endpoint value got changes
in following patch.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/236325/

This patch will test both public or publicURL endpoints.

Change-Id: I0dffb06c5151203e9fe2ab041a7beb028a39aac0
Closes-bug: #1517579

i don't think this is the correct solution. as mentioned in bug i think it actually functions correctly. two topics were defined for polling to publish to, two topics were defined for notification agent to listen to. the problem it seems is that there is some confusion because we use the same option to publish and subscribe depending on agent.

i think the easy solution is to be more descriptive in help message of notification_topics option. OR we create new options which are explicitly for publishing or subscribing.. i personally like the first option."}, {'account_id': 18137, 'date': '2015-11-06 17:48:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 15843, 'date': '2015-11-06 18:02:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hi gordon, the config option notification_topics is defined in oslo.message repo, see[1], so it not easy to directly change the help sting of the config option. also, I think it seems has a risk if we only depend on the documentation change. I personally prefer your second suggestion (add a new dedicated configure option)


[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.messaging/blob/master/oslo_messaging/notify/notifier.py#L35-L39'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2015-11-09 13:39:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

i guess that might make sense liusheng. maybe we can create an  option we use for ceilometer IPC'}, {'account_id': 18137, 'date': '2015-11-10 02:07:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

Thanks, @liusheng @gordon chung. I will work on that.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2015-11-10 17:57:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

i'm actually more in favour of a document change but others are welcome to tell me i'm wrong.

the problem i have with adding a new option is it further propagates incorrect idea that all services are tied/coupled together:

 - polling agent is designed to poll and emit datapoint
 - notification agent is designed to transform
 - collector is designed to persist data

if we create a dedicated topic just for polling -> notification, it implies polling and notifications are a coupled service when really they are not."}, {'account_id': 8290, 'date': '2015-11-11 07:59:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Hi gordon, yeah, this is make sense to me, how about we make change to ensure only one notification topic used by ceilometer-polling? we only need one notification topic to seed samples to notification-agent (regardless of which one). so may be we can change the notifier initialization [1] of polling agents, use the first notification topic from conf.notification_topics to init notifier. maybe the documentation is not a strong guarantee for operators :) what do you think ?'}, {'account_id': 8290, 'date': '2015-11-11 08:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ceilometer/blob/master/ceilometer/agent/manager.py#L276-L279'}, {'account_id': 18137, 'date': '2015-11-12 15:09:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Workflow

(3 comments)

@gordon chung Thanks for guidance. Liusheng left a new comment and it sounds good. What do you think of it?'}, {'account_id': 4491, 'date': '2015-11-12 16:17:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

@liusheng, using the first topic from notification_topics config options seems a little bit wacky to me. It would surprise the users because the code doesn't behave as they expected. You still needs to document this specialty on documentation. So to me, documentation is still the good way to tell users what/how they need to configure"}, {'account_id': 4491, 'date': '2015-11-12 16:20:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

maybe we could add some examples configurations for this multi topic situations, including how to configure polling-agent and notification-agent separately.'}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2015-11-12 16:36:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-03 02:30:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix duplicate meter samples

In ceilometer.conf, when configured notification_topics with more than
one value, as the listeners listen all the topics, so it causes
duplicate meter samples. Here if only one messaging_url exists, let the
listener only listen "notification" topic. if want to listen another
topic, need to configure another messaging_url.

Change-Id: I7af36f8e7615ccc31ffad94169b4e5ce1f9df84f
'}, {'created': '2015-11-03 02:36:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix duplicate meter samples

commit_message:
Clarify the doc about multiple notification_topics usage

Make clear that the multiple notification topic usage in ceilometer.conf
in case of mistakenly configured that cause duplicate samples.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1496777
Change-Id: I7af36f8e7615ccc31ffad94169b4e5ce1f9df84f

commit_message:
Increase timeout for dogtag related barbican functional tests

The dogtag related functional tests are sporadically failing due to
the timeout that's currently set.

Change-Id: Ic80592fb0afc8d2f7af0348fbdc103093befdaa8
