This proposal seems to be an awkward mix of semantics. There are two approaches which I think would make sense:

* The Abandon action exports the data and changes the stack state to ABANDON_COMPLETE. A subsequent Delete action removes the stack without deleting the physical resources.
* A new Export action exports the data without changing the stack state. A subsequent Abandon action deletes the stack without deleting the physical resources.

The former is the approach I proposed in the bug, and has the advantage of somewhat future-proofing us for convergence, since the not deleting physical resources during deletion currently relies on some stack-global in-memory state, and this would move it to the DB. The second approach has the possible benefit that the user can export at any time without affecting the stack, if we actually have a use case for that (do we?).

Either of those would basically make sense I think. However the patch implements a hybrid approach: the export action changes the state and then the abandon action deletes the stack. This approach makes no sense IMHO. The EXPORT_COMPLETE state doesn't mean anything, there's no reason to have it."}, {'account_id': 10487, 'date': '2015-07-06 11:29:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14: Workflow-1

Zane, Thanks for clarifying here. 

I will update the patches with export approach. as in case of other approach, if user wants to delete the physical resources after abandon followed by delete, it won't be possible (as after abandon, user does not have choice to remove the physical resources)

Jason: I will remove the constrain on the export dependency and it will be inline with you."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2015-07-06 23:00:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

> as in case of other approach, if user wants to delete the physical resources after abandon followed by delete, it won't be possible

This is why I suggested that the Adopt action should be allowed when in the ABANDON_COMPLETE state - that would return the stack to normal operation (the user wouldn't even have to pass any data) so that a subsequent delete could remove the physical resources again."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2015-07-06 23:03:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

[Correction: that was Vijendar's suggestion, which I agreed with.]"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-07-07 07:50:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Verified-1

commit_message:
Split abandon into pre-abandon(export) and abandon

Splits the existing abandon action into two actions as
below:
1. export: User is recommended to run export successfully
   before doing the abandon action. It returns the stack
   data, which can be used for adopting stack.
2. abandon: Abandons the given stack

Partial-Bug: #1353670

Co-Authored-By: Jason Dunsmore <jasondunsmore@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I65264d91b1378df9cb3e492bc6ccaa778940dd6b

[{'created': '2015-11-23 03:02:06.000000000', 'message': "Ignore KeyError for secret field

Although it doesn't make sense to create a datasource without
providing auth info in config info, it may be not possible to
define a schema to verify because different datasource drivers
may use different kinds of auth methods. So we should be able
to handle the case that none secret info is provided. The fix
just simply ignores KeyError exception here.

Change-Id: I06bc6a4fb659d862da96dd96557454b6385d003f
Closes-Bug: #1492354
(cherry picked from commit 22210a9ee65526ca0ccaf448260d2d9de0ff9c12)
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore KeyError for secret field

Although it doesn't make sense to create a datasource without
providing auth info in config info, it may be not possible to
define a schema to verify because different datasource drivers
may use different kinds of auth methods. So we should be able
to handle the case that none secret info is provided. The fix
just simply ignores KeyError exception here.

Change-Id: I06bc6a4fb659d862da96dd96557454b6385d003f
Closes-Bug: #1492354
(cherry picked from commit 22210a9ee65526ca0ccaf448260d2d9de0ff9c12)

commit_message:
utils.build: added helpers functions

* rsync_inject allows to rsync custom directoies
into chroot
* runtime_uuid allows save runtime_uuid to yaml file

Change-Id: I5ae438756823c0370b0bccfde6fb3f353315b191
Implements: blueprint dynamically-build-bootstrap

commit_message:
Improvements of TestRail reporter for system_tests

Improve behavior of upload_cases_description.py and report.py for new
type of system test

Implements blueprint template-based-testcases

Change-Id: I965ce7159a1497840775219db4c601821f5a66b1

When a tenant access a subresource, neutron will check that this
tenant is allowed to view this subresource, according to the policy.json.
The plugin must return the tenant_id parameter when a "show/list/delete"
action is performed, so that the policy framework can check authz.

This patch also set the network_id as a mandatory parameter
in the network_association table.

Fixes-Bug: #1512789
'}]
commit_message:
Add tenant-id to subresources

When a tenant access a subresource, neutron will check that this
tenant is allowed to view this subresource, according to the policy.json.
The plugin must return the tenant_id parameter when a "show/list/delete"
action is performed, so that the policy framework can check authz.

This patch also set the network_id as a mandatory parameter
in the network_association table.

Change-Id: I59d2dbb5416b566dc7de3acb4fab3ed2ada8b78e
Fixes-Bug: #1512789

commit_message:
Improvements for windows snapshots

freezer now recreate a snapshot if freezer symlink is present
and snapshots are now not used by default

Change-Id: Ie1aba42db7f74215c25593abcf2835400d8ebed2

commit_message:
Remove qpidd's driver from the tree

Back in liberty we marked this driver as deprecated. This patch removes
it from the tree. The patch also removes tests, options and other
references in the documentation. Note that one script is being kept
because it's required by the amqp driver.

Depends-On: If4b1773334e424d1f4a4e112bd1f10aca62682a9
Change-Id: I4a9cba314c4a2f24307504fa7b5427424268b114

Personally, I don't know the benefit of doing this change.   If others agree we should do this, there is another change you should consider also:

* /api/openstack/compute/legacy_v2/limits.py - if group[:1] != '(' or group[-1:] != ')'"}, {'account_id': 18602, 'date': '2015-11-03 17:51:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 18602, 'date': '2015-11-03 18:37:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Cale Rath: Thanks for your comment, I ignored that. Updated the patchset. 

And as I said in the commit message, this modification makes the code cleaner, less error prone, it enhances the readibility. A really simple example is the following: you have a code like this

someString = "Hello there! Please check my starting or ending"
if someString[-3:] == "ing":
    print("OK")
if someString[:5] == "Hello":
    print("OK")

It works perfectly. But there could be a reason to change the comparison's right side and on may forget to change the left side of the same comparison (as we all humans, it can happen anytime). So you would have a code like this:

if someString[:5] == "Hello there":
    print("OK")

Of course, it won't throw any error, as it's a valid code in fact. It will always return false, instead. And problems like this may take a time to fix. 

But, if you use the built-in startwith() and endswith() methods, it can never happen, as you don't need to change the left side (there won't be left side, anyway).'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-03 19:38:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

commit_message:
Check prefix with startswith() instead of slicing

Replaced string slicing with startswith() method to check for prefixes.
The startswith() is cleaner and less error prone thus enhances the readibility and stability of the code.

Change-Id: Ia2e9a02128ef11cdf7512c96726503b85edc52aa

commit_message:
Change comments and description for minimum_basic test

Extented test description and added comments for ssh connections
used in test to avoid misinterpretation.

Change-Id: I3ae5dd45a88f96a1a467e94bf88307b14b4621d4

commit_message:
Adds test case for the iscsi_ilo recreate boot iso

When using web server for hosting images for ilo driver,
take_over should recreate the boot ISO, if it was created
by Ironic. This fix is done as part of the feature patch
I5481e705892f66cb3184ac16ff56c123f5c69087 in boot.py from
lines 117-122.
The test case for this bug is missing in the feature patch
and hence adding it here in this patch.

Related-Bug: #1510425

Change-Id: I6b7f3901f773a5aba906c50dcbd574412f7b6af3

commit_message:
Import pep3134daemon as local module

pep3134daemon is now imported from local path
rather than pip. This generated many issues
as the package is not in the global-requirements.txt
of kilo and liberty. Also pbr in the kilo release
does not support env markers which further complitated
the installation. This change needs to be backported to
stable/kilo also.

Also some minor fix for RST format.

Compared to the liberty commit this one is cherry-picked from, a few
modifications were needed:

requirements.txt : Tiny reorganisation
setup.py : Removal of the old platform-dependant deps installation

Change-Id: I34db28ffc928703b01e6430a661214d66d81c519
(cherry picked from commit 3abf2080f1ed0ec733e246af9ff877ac84159c52)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-11-20 15:19:06.000000000', 'message': "Don't force Fn::Select index to integer

Fn::Select try to cast its index argument to integer in all the cases,
but it also needs to use it as a string when you give it a mapping. This
moves the cast after the mapping case has been handled.

Change-Id: I84ff404d3a26fb51c2048e43851b1ef5e3031d67
Closes-Bug: #1518337
"}]
commit_message:
Don't force Fn::Select index to integer

Fn::Select try to cast its index argument to integer in all the cases,
but it also needs to use it as a string when you give it a mapping. This
moves the cast after the mapping case has been handled.

Change-Id: I84ff404d3a26fb51c2048e43851b1ef5e3031d67
Closes-Bug: #1518337

Mesos functional test was proposed in this patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/225212/ . Adding a mesos pipeline is a non-trivial process, which might take a while to implement. It is undesired to block mesos-related enhancement because of missing of a gate. 

It would be a big help if someone volunteers to serve as a human gate: manually download this patch and verify it works. If anyone can help with that, it will be greatly appreciated.'}, {'account_id': 8143, 'date': '2015-11-18 06:33:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Hongbin: fear enough ;), I will test it this week (sorry cannot provide exact date, crazy time at work ):)'}, {'account_id': 9591, 'date': '2015-11-18 16:07:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

For manually testing this patch, and looking ahead to functional test, should we place a pre-built image on the fedora site?  This would save everyone from building their own image, and potentially running into error outside of the patch itself.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2015-11-18 23:32:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Ton, I would like to do so, but I am not sure if fedora allows to host a ubuntu-based image. I need to find the right person to confirm it.'}, {'account_id': 8143, 'date': '2015-11-19 00:39:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Ton: I think we discussed it before and agreement was to upload image to tarballs.openstack.org and test will download and extract it.'}, {'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2015-11-19 22:55:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-20 01:01:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1

commit_message:
Refactor Mesos templates

Move Mesos master into its own nested template. This will make the
style consistent with k8s templates.

Change-Id: Icfb0df1b486febacc08f34ca86a58a80dc83f812
Partial-Implements: blueprint heat-network-refactor

Added new option in kolla-build.conf

Add liaison for senlin project

This patch adds Qiming Teng as liaison for the Senlin project.

Change-Id: I2403064284dae05e6674e5ca4e62447d3e10cec0

commit_message:
Port EMC VMAX to Python 3

* Fix EMCVMAXMasking._get_storage_group_from_masking_view_instance():
  replace "if groups[0] > 0:" with "if len(groups):"
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_emc_vmax

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I0f6be3cc0873efe683d39c4c70e19d0d0b79beb8

commit_message:
Port EMC VNX CLI to Python 3

CreateConsistencyGroupTask, WaitMigrationsCompleteTask: sort the lun
identifier keys to have a determinist order. On Python 3, the hash
function is randomized, so set() order is undefined and changes at
each run.

Other changes:

* Replace map() with list-comprehension to get a list on Python 3.
* Replace assertTrue(str.find(pattern) > 0) with
  assertIn(pattern, str) to not fail if pattern is at the beginning
  on the string. On Python 3, the hash function is randomized and so
  parts of the provider_location are in a random order, it can be at
  the beginning.
* tests-py3.txt: add cinder.tests.unit.test_emc_vnxdirect

Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I114029c1c9862583e64781379001870a682ea42d

commit_message:
Use a dict to translate node power states to json data.

The input of set_power_state() is different from the real string
it sends to Ironic service in json data. The power states were
translated in set_power_state(). Using a dict to map the translation
is more clear, and easier to add new power states.

Change-Id: I8c7dac1ac39f92b2031e7f1fa95cd5c398a708d5
Implements: blueprint enhance-power-interface-for-soft-reboot-and-nmi
Related-to: blueprint soft-reboot-poweroff
Related-to: blueprint instance-crash-dump

[{'created': '2015-11-19 14:12:03.000000000', 'message': "Disallow user changing size of deactivated image

Currently in glance V1 a user can change the size of an image whilst
'deactivated' as it is no longer in the 'active' state. This should not
be the case as an image should be immutable by normal users while in the
'deactivated' state.

Change-Id: I744fbce90893008ef49568c3cba47bf0e26dec9d
Closes-Bug: 1517060
"}, {'created': '2015-11-19 16:35:20.000000000', 'message': "Disallow user modifing ACTIVE_IMMUTABLE of deactivated images

Currently the user can change the ACTIVE_IMMUTABLE properties whilst
the image is 'deactivated'. This should not be the case once an image
has become 'active'.

APIImpact
Change-Id: I744fbce90893008ef49568c3cba47bf0e26dec9d
Closes-Bug: 1517060
Closes-Bug: 1517963
"}]
commit_message:
Disallow user modifing ACTIVE_IMMUTABLE of deactivated images

Currently the user can change the ACTIVE_IMMUTABLE properties whilst
the image is 'deactivated'. This should not be the case once an image
has become 'active'.

APIImpact
Change-Id: I744fbce90893008ef49568c3cba47bf0e26dec9d
Closes-Bug: 1517060
Closes-Bug: 1517963

commit_message:
Add Reject option to Firewall Rules

Although Neutron API and Neutronclient support Reject action
in Firewall Rule, it is missing in Horizon. This change
proposes to add the 'Reject' action option to the Firewall
rule in the 'Add Rule' workflow and the 'Edit Rule' form.

Change-Id: Ibf6072948becdc1852464826a04f08127bd85113
Closes-Bug: #1516856
